Gooood morning! Today is a great day to practice finding your smile. 😃 Don't let any opportunities for a moment of happiness pass you by.
If you sense a smile or a laugh coming on, let it out. Feel it, don't conceal it. Create a little joy today, for yourself or someone else. Have an awesome day yogis. ✌❤😃

When you know how to find your peace, no matter where you are or what's going on around you or in your life, you will always have peace. No one can take that from you, except you. Take a moment to tune in to your breath and practice finding your peace today...even if it's only for 5 minutes. ✌️ @caleyalyssa

There is exquisite beauty to be found in between moments. ✨

This scorpion handstand is far from perfect. In fact, what you see here is actually the moment before I flipped over and fell out of it.
Sometimes the greatest photos are snapped during the in between moments. The moments when we aren't paying attention and are simply being.
Sometimes the greatest experiences occur during the in between moments. The moments when it becomes all about the journey, and the destination becomes less important.

Notice the in between moments. Become present to their presence, because they represent many more opportunities to experience the exquisite beauty of the in between. ✨

Here's what I'm going to do: keep breathing and try to smile (even if it's only a little twitch at the corners of my mouth). Maybe if I smile with my mouth, it'll start spreading to the rest of me. And today, that's enough. 😊

Thank you so much for all of your amazing mantra shares! They are SO inspiring, authentic, and absolutely beautiful. ❤️ Now for Day 2: Bed-Asana

Before you even get out of bed (or right after, it's up to you) take some time to lead your body through a few simple stretches. Instead of suggesting the poses, we want you to listen to your bodies and let them make the suggestions.

Our bodies often tell us exactly what we need, but we don't always hear what they're saying. Check in with your body and see where you're feeling a little creaky or tense, then stretch it out.
Once you finish stretching, snap a photo of your lovable self in the stretching pose that felt best to you, looking just as you did when you woke up.

Remember, bedhead, zits, and morning dragon breath are things we all have in common, so don't be afraid. Rock your bedhead like it's nobody's business, and so will we. 😃 @aloyoga

Anytime, any place, any size, any shape,

Today we visited The Nelson Mandela Capture site. The more I learn about him, the more I am inspired.
-
To reach this beautiful monument on the grounds, you must walk down a long path, which is symbolic of Mandela's "long walk to freedom."
-
As I walked down this path, I felt grateful for my own freedom. As a Caucasian American, I so often take my freedom and equality for granted. They're all I've ever known, and I've never experienced life without these basic rights.
-
Being here in South Africa, and learning about the fairly recent history of this country, reminds me that freedom and equality are rarely free. Often they come at a very costly price, where many people must make great sacrifices.
-
To my forefathers and foremothers, who sacrificed and fought for the freedom and equality that I sometimes take for granted: I know l don't think it often enough, but thank you, thank you, thank you. ✌🏻️❤️🇿🇦

I've been working at this one for a long time, and have never gotten this close!
Do I wish that I was also in a hollowback position looking back through my arms? Sure. Do I wish my shoulders were more flexible so that I could access hollowback poses? Definitely.

Be patient, appreciate every moment, and focus on the positive. 😊

Life has been throwing an above average number of new obstacles into my path lately, and I was really starting to let it get me down.
.
I know life is wavy, filled with crests and troughs, highs and lows, but if I’m not careful, the lows can extend longer than they should.
.
When I’m feeling down, all of a sudden going to yoga, working out, being social, eating the right foods, and sometimes even just leaving the house becomes a challenge.
.
It’s funny how the things that I know make me feel good, become the very things that I don’t want to do if I’m depressed. It’s a vicious cycle, and I’ve learned that it gets harder to break it the longer I allow it to continue.
.
I’ve been working hard for the last week to break the crappy cycle I’ve been stuck in. I’m focused on my sleep, my nutrition, my physical activity level, and I’ve spent some nourishing time with good friends.
.
It usually takes a few days of forcing myself, no matter how hard it feels, to just get up and do the things I know I should do. One baby step at a time.
.
It can be a struggle, but, usually soon after, I’m rewarded with a day like today.
.
I woke up this morning with a smile that I’ve been able to maintain all day long, even when tested, and I’m still shining.
.
I find myself remembering how to laugh in the face of life’s obstacles again, rather than letting each one be the straw that breaks this camels back.
.
I know it can be easy to get overwhelmed when you’re feeling low, and maybe even forget that there REALLY IS a bright light waiting for you at the end of the tunnel.
.
If that’s happening to you right now, I’m here to remind you, from my own experience, that just because you’re having a bad day, week, month, or year, doesn’t mean you have a bad life.
.
Hang in there, and be extra loving to yourself, because you deserve it. Trust that there WILL come a day, when whatever storm is passing through your life, will yield the most fantastic rainbow that you’ve ever seen. 💗
.

Hi everyone. While this is a lighthearted photo, this is also a serious post.
I've had the pleasure of enjoying the beautiful country of Turkey for the past week, and I've come to deeply appreciate the culture and the people who live here.

Right now the Turkish people are hurting. An awful disaster has occurred in a mine in Soma, Turkey, and many of the mine workers are injured or have been killed.

It's not like me to make anything other than positive posts, but I can't in good conscience make another post about how blissful my days here have been, while the people, in the country that has provided me with all of these beautiful experiences, photos and videos, are suffering so deeply.

We may all be citizens of different countries, but we are all citizens of the same universe. Please take a moment to meditate, send good vibes, pray, or whatever works for you, for our fellow universe citizens in Turkey.
Know that I am doing the same.

Thank you.

Lately I find myself constantly reminded of how important it is to be present, really present, in order to truly enjoy my life. This is even more true in the face of adversity, because I've learned that adversity can seriously distract me from the here and now and bring out my inner pessimist, if I'm not careful.
.
I've stumbled over quite a few obstacles recently, and I've realized that whenever a challenging situation arises, I have 2 choices: let it get the best of me, keep me from enjoying whatever I'm presently doing, try unsuccessfully to control that which I cannot, and spend excess energy feeling sorry for myself OR stay present to the here and now, enjoy what I'm presently doing, accept that I can't control everything, and move onward and upward.
.
I woke up today and decided I've been choosing the first option a little too often....but I'm more aware of it than ever and making a concerted effort to change my reactions, because those I CAN control. ☀️
-

For the longest time, I used to dread this day. Exactly how much I would dread it, believe it or not, was in direct proportion to how GOOD my year had been. Sound weird? I know, but let me explain. 😉
Gratefully, for most of my life, each year has been better than the last; and yet at the end of each year, I would become afraid that it had been my best year. The reason I was afraid was because I couldn’t conceive of how I could have a better year than the one I just had. 😱
What if my luck had run out? What if it’s all down hill from here? The next year was definitely not going to be as good. I was convinced. 🙅🏼‍♀️
As you can imagine, NYE was a depressing holiday for me, and even if I was at a party, I’d usually sneak to the bathroom for a good cry at some point. 😭
This year though, it’s different. 🙏🏻
It’s not that I’ve had a bad year, and it’s only up from here. Not at all. Apart from some seriously challenging moments, all and all I’ve had another great year, but this year, on this day, I’m no longer afraid. 👊🏻
This year, I have more faith in myself than ever before. I don’t feel that life is happening to me, while I rely on luck, and that next year my luck might run out. 🙌🏻
This year, I know that I make my own luck. Because after all, luck is where preparation meets opportunity, and consider me prepared to make next year an epic year for the books. ⚡️
I know it’s easy to go down the rabbit hole today. Whether it’s being overly critical of the year behind you, or fearful of the year ahead— I challenge you, this year, to stop that cycle. ✋🏻
If you’re having trouble stopping it, I get it. I’ve been there and might be again in the future, who knows? But take it from me: no matter what happened this year, you have the power to make next year whatever you want it to be. 🙌🏻💗🙌🏻💗🙌🏻
.
📸: @lifeinabeachtown

Good morning from me and my dog Neila! Last night I put up a photo of a coat that I wanted to win, and I got some very nasty reactions from some of you.
To those of you going out of your way to be negative and posting on my page to tell me that I'm "not a true yogi" or that I'm an "animal killer" ... Google Ahimsa and try practicing it yourself.

I have nothing but respect for all the vegans out there, however, I am not a vegan. I wish that all of the haters from last night (who also all happen to be vegan), would have the same attitude and the same respect for me and my views, although I choose not to be vegan. Dear nasty vegans (just to clarify, nice vegans are awesome), and anyone else who thinks that your sh*t doesn't stink... Please get over yourselves, because yours stinks too.

This brings me to another point of contention. The nasty vegans from last night brought this to mind, but they aren't by any means the only ones guilty of it. People, yes yogis I'm talking to you too, please stop being so negative and judgmental to the people in your life, including me.

If you have a negative comment to make, do yourself and everyone around you a favor, (again including me), and consider keeping it to yourself next time. What do you achieve by being so negative? Did it make you feel better about yourself to call me an animal killer? Why is that?

Judge yourself before you judge others, although for your sake, I hope that you aren't as harsh on yourselves as you were on me. Give the people in your life a break today, and say something nice instead.
Have an awesome day yogis! ❤

I wrote an epic caption to go with this photo. It took me about an hour to write, and I was really proud of it.
.
Then, my phone died, of course, and I lost it all.
I got really mad for a second, started to curse the cosmos, and then I stopped and started laughing instead.
.
It's just a caption, I reminded myself, and then I laughed some more.
.
This happens to me a lot. Something minor occurs, but I decide to make it major and freak out. Key words: "I decide."
.
Life is all about decisions. This morning, I decided to laugh, instead of freak out, and man did it feel better!
.
I started to get mad again as I was trying to rewrite the caption, knowing it would never be as good as the first one.
.
Then I realized, sharing this experience might be even more impactful, in fact, than the previous perfect caption I had composed.
.
So, here ya go, my words of inspiration for the day: whatever IT is, take a moment to see if it's really as big of a deal as you're making it. If it's not, which, in my experience, it probably isn't, have a sense of humor and share a good laugh with yourself. ☀️
-

Wow! I'm finally coming back to life! 2016 has been the rockiest start of any year yet, complete with being stranded and an insane stomach virus, but I'm actually feeling really positive.
.
Until yesterday, I was so sick that I couldn't move. It was AWFUL. I'm pretty sure it was also a wake up call from the universe that I needed to rest. REALLY REST. I had burned the candle at both ends for too long and it took a big toll on my immune system.
.
Here's what's making me feel positive though: I'm SO grateful for this entire 2016 experience so far. While being stranded, sick, and forced to rest may have been painful and challenging, it gave me a chance to start the year with an epic realization.
.
Rest and free time are SO important, and I haven't given myself enough of either. For months, "free time" has meant catching up on emails, social media, and texting, while also trying to actually enjoy whatever my free time activity was (friends, reading, tv, etc.).
.
I was multi-tasking so much that I didn't enjoy my free time. I felt like, no matter what, I never had enough time in the day to simply enjoy myself and wind down. Then I'd stay up too late, trying to make the day last a little longer and find time to give myself a break.
.
The next day I'd wake up tired, and the cycle would continue. It's not a sustainable way to live, and I really see that now. Hello work-life balance!
.
The best part? I was so afraid to really let go EVER, and now I've been forced to for about a week, and my world didn't end. Instead, it got better.
.
I was weak, so I had to zero in on my priorities and be as efficient as possible with my energy. As I practiced this, I inadvertently re-tapped the well of motivation and energy I had been missing for months. Plus, when I view it all through fresh eyes, my social media and emails don't actually take that long if I really sit down and focus.
.
My real New Years resolution came about 9 days late, and it is this: In 2016 I will love myself unconditionally and maintain a sustainable work-life balance. 2016 is already shaping up to be a HUGE year, and I'm going to need all the energy I can... to stop and enjoy it all along the way. ✌🏻️❤️😉

They say never to ask a woman her age, and for the most part, it’s an old adage that I adhere to. 🙊
I rarely ask other women their ages, and I find that, except when they’re under the age of 25 (a.k.a. still excited to discuss their age), other women rarely ask me. 🤐
I guess I’ve been feeling a little old lately. Especially when my younger friends forget I’m older, and say things like “yikes I’m almost 30, so I better get moving,” as if 30 is the beginning of the end or something. But I remember feeling that way too, so I don’t blame them. 🤷🏼‍♀️
I used to get the question “How old are you?” on here all the time, but I guess people finally realized I wasn’t going to answer, and just stopped asking. 🙅🏼‍♀️
Well, fuck that. Fuck all of that— both feeling old, and treating my age like it’s anything other than a badge of honor. 😜
Looking at this photo, I’m proud to say that, after a lot of hard work both inside and out, and at the ripe NOT-old age of 32, this is the most that I’ve ever loved my life, myself, and my body. 🙌🏻
I may not be able to drink like I used to (thank god! 😂), I may need more sleep and have darker circles under my eyes when I don’t get it, but you know what? It doesn’t stop me from being grateful for every passing year, and even the wrinkles that come with it. 🙏🏻
In the interest of saying fuck it and being proud of the wisdom in our years, let me ask you this:
How old are you? 😉
.
📸: @iliscrub

Believe it or not, I’m really intimidated by public transportation, mostly because I’m not used to it. During my time in NYC, it’s been my biggest struggle. The same was true when I lived in Paris for a year. 🚇
Having grown up in Michigan, and having spent the bulk of my time after in Arizona and California, I’m used to having a car at my disposal, driving everywhere, and being able to get up and go whenever I please. 🚘
I’ve found that this ability to be mobile, on demand, is something that I’m really attached to, because it’s a crutch I lean on to get past some of my underlying issues. 🏃‍♀️
I carry around a fair amount of social anxiety with me at all times, and it’s compounded when I find myself in large crowds, where I don’t have any personal space. Combine that with my hatred of waiting idly, and my tendency toward procrastination of things that make me uncomfortable, and you’ll find me waiting until the last minute to leave home if I know the journey ahead will involve the subway. Plus, what if I get on the wrong train, lose my ticket, or have some other mishap happen that I don’t even know to worry about yet? 😱
In NYC, avoiding the subway is both costly (holy UBER bills!) and timely (holy rush hour!). I want to save money and stop being 20 minutes late (on the low end 😬) wherever I go, but to do so, I will have to overcome my fear of public transportation, which really means overcoming the issues that riding the subway shines a light on. 💡
It means that I’ll have to get comfortable with being closely surrounded by lots of people. It means I’ll have to plan ahead. It means I’ll have to stop procrastinating. It means I’ll have to be respectful of others time. 🙌🏻
Sometimes the things that make us want to run away, are actually the things we should be running towards. I’ve been wanting to overcome these issues of mine for awhile, but who knew it would be my nemesis, the subway, that would finally inspire me to actually start trying. 🤷🏼‍♀️
Now that you know about my fears (irrational, I know, but oh well) surrounding riding on the subway, maybe you’ll understand why I look SO happy to be alone in this train car. 💃🏼😂
.

I woke up this morning and basically had a heart attack when I realized what had occurred. (See it in action on Snapchat: GypsetGoddess).
I want to sincerely thank everyone who supported me, encouraged me, and consoled me throughout this challenging day.
I'm so grateful to be a part of such an amazing global conscious community, where family, friends, and strangers alike, care about me enough to take the time to make sure I'm okay, remind me to look on the bright side, and have faith that everything always works out one way or another.

I woke up this morning filled with an aimless self doubt. 🤷🏼‍♀️
.
It’s weird, because my life is actually exactly where I want it to be right now. Things are falling into place in a magical way, and I’m feeling so grateful, so this sudden self doubt feels out of place. Does this ever happen to you? 🤷🏼‍♀️
.
I was talking to my roommate @ianahealey about it, and he gave me a good trick to use in these moments. He has a name for the self doubt I woke up with: “The What-If Game”, and I had been playing a negative What-If Game. 😤
.
“What if things are about to stop going my way?”
“What if I was wrong, and things actually aren’t even going my way at all?”
“What if I got excited too quickly about new opportunities and they end up falling through?” 😧
.
I know that these doubts are baseless for the most part, but it didn’t stop them from being present this morning. Then @ianahealey suggested I try playing a positive What-If Game. 💡
.
“What if things keep going my way?”
“What if I’m right, and things really are aligning the way I’ve wanted them to?”
“What if all of these opportunities come through, and then even more arise?” 😃
.
These positive What-If questions and the likelihood of their outcomes are just as likely as the negative What-Ifs...probably even more so honestly. So why are many of us so quick to go down a negative What-If rabbit hole? 🤷🏼‍♀️
.
It’s easy to forget that we each really do have the power to shift our focus and amend our thinking on any issue, at anytime. Your mind is strong, but YOU are stronger! 💪🏻
.
So the next time you find yourself falling down a negative What-If Game spiral, I challenge you to flip your script. Make it a positive What-If Game, and see how this impacts your experience. 🔮
.
It’s been a game changer for my morning today, and I imagine it will be for many more to come. Hope it helps you too. 💗
.

Do you have an emotional reaction to this pose? Does practicing this pose, and other hip opening poses, make you feel angry or sad?
We tend to hold the tension from our repressed emotions in our hips. Sometimes practicing hip opening poses like this one can trigger a release of those repressed emotions.

Rather than avoiding hip opening poses, because they make you feel angry or sad, relish the chance to become aware of what you need to let go.

When you have a strong emotional reaction to any pose, don't let your emotions have the final say. Treat this experience as a beautiful opportunity that your body has given you, to become aware and to look within and analyze how you are truly experiencing your life.

Our emotions and experiences are a backpack that we constantly carry. It's good to have them around for when we need them. If we keep shoving emotions and experiences that don't serve us to the bottom of the bag instead of letting them go, the backpack becomes too heavy to carry.
Don't let your metaphorical backpack slow you down. In letting go of whatever doesn't serve us, we achieve freedom and a quality of lightness that is a precursor to joy.

Be light. Be bright. Be happy.

Let it happen. Let it be. Let it go. ❤

My favorite way to move into handstands? Slow and controlled. Less momentum, more engagement.
Handstands were a total crapshoot for me until I learned to focus on kicking my top leg, not jumping with my bottom leg, to kick up into handstand.

Changing my focus from jumping to kicking changed everything. It slowed down my momentum and gave me enough control to help me learn the deep subtleties of hand balancing.

Slow down today, take a breath, and give yourself a chance to see the beautiful subtleties of whatever you are doing. ✌

A friend gave me some wise advice today. Here is what he had to say:
"Sometimes the universe knocks at your door when it's time for you to make a positive change.
If you don't answer, it knocks harder. If you still don't answer, the universe starts to kick your door and make more noise hoping you listen.
If you still don't answer, the universe will break your door down and you'll be forced to make the change if you want to continue to thrive.
Depending on how open you are to change, it may be as graceful as a swan landing in the water or as turbulent as a plane crashing, but either way it will happen.
Be the swan, invite in and accept change with grace."
Well then, call me a swan. ✌🏻️
.

I'm working on one of my biggest projects to date, and all day I've been hitting a massive wall of self doubt. All of the intimidating things, that I didn't even know that I didn't know, seem to be presenting themselves, and for a while I let it get me down.
But then I took a step back, and tuned into gratitude. Gratitude that I have the courage to stand up to that wall of self doubt, and see it as an opportunity to learn and grow, an opportunity to surprise myself by doing something I didn't know if I could.
Gratitude that I am strong enough to take this wall apart brick by brick if I have to, until I'm on the other side looking back at how far I've come, and feeling grateful that I didn't let the fear make me quit.
If you're hitting a wall of self doubt anywhere in your life, take it from me, you are strong enough to overcome it! Break that shit apart brick by brick if you have to.
See you on the other side. 👊🏻

I used to go on vacation and wish it would never end. I'd "accidentally" 😉miss flights, in order to stay a few extra days without having to admit how much I was avoiding my real life.
Lately I've challenged myself to make decisions differently. I step out of my comfort zone every chance I get, and rather than running away, I run toward the things I'm afraid of.
For awhile, I wondered if making these difficult decisions was even worth it. I wondered if I would ever feel truly capable of dealing with life's trials and tribulations, or if they would continue to break me down at almost every turn. Was any of this even working?
I never really know the answers to these sorts of questions until I'm tested, and that is definitely happening right now.
In the time since I arrived in Greece, I've had a scary and disappointing health wake up call, had both my house and my car broken into back in LA, and shattered my phone beyond repair.
But here's how I know I've changed my life: before, with all of this on my plate, I would have avoided going home like the plague. I probably would have missed at least 3 flights. 😉
However, even with the mountain of shit waiting for me, I can't wait to get back. I'm consistently letting go of the people, places, and things that no longer serve me, which is still scary, but I'm being rewarded.
All of this has created a lot of space, and so far I've filled that space by finding the love of my life and attracting an abundance of exciting new opportunities... and now those are waiting for me too.
This wealth of both pain and joy, has taught me a very valuable lesson: unexpected life events, that are out of my control, will never stop happening, because that's simply the nature of life. But, as long as I control the things I CAN control, and fill my life with enough joy to sustain me through life's tests, then nothing, and I mean nothing, will be able to break me.
If you're struggling, hang in there. Control the things you can control, and make the space to fill with joy. Even if you don't have any notion of where you'll find that joy, make the space anyway and the joy will find you. Trust me. 💗
.

Hello beautiful people! I’m back. 🤗
Took an unplanned, but very necessary as it turns out, social media sabbatical. 💆🏼‍♀️
I needed a moment to clear my head and reignite my fire to share myself here. 🔥
I actually tried to post a few times over the last 7 days, but couldn’t find the words, so I waited until I had some. 🤷🏼‍♀️
In our constantly scrolling and overstimulated reality, it’s important to me that every one of my posts matters, and that each of my captions offer some level of value to you (this is my hope). 🙏🏻
I figure if I’m going to eat up your time with my posts, I don’t want you to feel after that your time has been wasted. I want to add something to your day, whether that means teaching you something, letting you see you aren’t alone, reminding you how lovable and enough you are, or simply making you feel something. 💗
Sharing for the sake of sharing doesn’t light my fire, but sharing with a purpose does. Sometimes that purpose gets lost, and I need a break to find it again. I found it this morning. 🔥
Of all of my realizations over the last 7 days, perhaps the most beneficial are these 2 nuggets:
-Take breaks to stoke and reignite your fire when you need to. Better to show up to your daily life with joy and energy than with dread and fatigue. 🙌🏻
-Ask yourself this question the next time you go to post on IG or any other social media: what is my intention for posting this right now? 🤔
There’s no right or wrong or better or worse answer, but I find it to be a helpful question to build awareness around how and why we are all here together on this platform. 👋🏻
I asked myself that question, and this post is what came out of it. 💗
Good things they are a coming. Ready for the weekend and ready for today to be tonight! 😃

Everyday, every moment, we have the power to choose the lens through which we will view the world. Choose to view the world through a positive (but realistic, not rose-tinted 😉) lens today, and see how it impacts your experience. You may find that you love what you see. ❤️

Wow!! I got more than I bargained for with my forced NYE unplug! LOL. The boat that was supposed to pick @andrew7sealy and I up the next day never showed. I insisted that Andrew take the lone jet ski ride out, and then I waited 3 more days for a boat/jet ski/kayak/anything to take me out...but it never came.
.
See this look of resignation on my face? That's the face of a girl who's been stranded for 3 days longer than planned, and who's just accepted that to get out, she is about to hike one of the most beautiful, but also gnarliest and dangerous, hikes in the entire world: The Kalalau Trail.
.
It's 11-12 miles through the jungle, mountains, coastline, and some seriously narrow passes to cross with hundreds of feet to drop (Google Crawlers Ledge to see what I mean).
.
I've been to this island probably 10 times and never hiked the Kalalau trail...purposely so. I did not want any part of that. However, the island had other plans for me. This time, I wasn't allowed to avoid the hike.
.
I put one foot in front of the other, huffed, puffed, went to a lot of dark places in my mind, and may have gone a little manic and sang and skipped up steep mountain sides, when I though I might die...but the point is...I MADE IT AND I WOULDNT CHANGE MY EXPERIENCE FOR ANYTHING IN THE WORLD. 😃

Today I'm feeling grateful for the power of social media to connect people.
Truthful moment: I suffer from social anxiety. You might not feel that coming from my posts, but it's usually there lurking behind the scenes.

For a long time I felt stifled and sometimes even paralyzed by it. Practicing yoga has helped me learn to manage my anxiety, but it hasn't taught me to overcome it.

However, I had the realization yesterday that I've turned a new page in my anxiety journey.
In the past, I would meet new people and be so nervous that I would clam up and become inauthentic, trying too hard to make people love and accept me. So, as a result I kept meeting new people to a minimum.
Enter social media, mainly Instagram. This beautiful medium of connection has changed my life.
Through Instagram, I've found the courage to meet and deeply connect with more people than I could ever have imagined. I went to 2 meetings yesterday, and they were both turned out awesome.

I headed to each one telling myself my same old story: "you're going to get shy, act like a weirdo, and screw this up." What a lame way to talk to myself.

Then I went to both meetings and did not get shy, did not act like a weirdo, and did not screw anything up. This brings me to my realization: I may have been afraid to meet new people and felt paralyzed by social anxiety in the past, but that's an old story. It's no longer true.

In reality, I'm not shy anymore, and I'm definitely not paralyzed. I am a weirdo, but in a good way, and I love my quirks. In this photo from yesterday, I'm jumping for joy with Crissy from @chintwins.

Do I look shy? Or weird? Or like a screw up? Nope. I look happy, and I feel happy too.

What stories do you tell yourself about the way you interact with the world? Are they true? You just might find, as I have, that some of your negative stories of the past deserve a present and positive update.
Live in the present, and give yourself credit for the self-work that you are doing. Keep working, keep improving, keep believing. Then one day you might just wake up and realize you have a new and positive story to tell yourself. ✌️

A perfect yoga pose doesn't mean a perfect yogi, but in our Insta world, this is sometimes easy to forget.
One of my favorite teachers once said "the more beautiful the practice, often the more flawed the yogi." I'm not sure I agree with that entirely, but I don't think it's a groundless claim either.
Most of us have at one time or another met a yogi who has perfect handstands, but questionable karma.
I hope when you look at me, you see more than my flexibility or my balance.
Neither of these qualities have anything to do with who I actually am...they're just what you see on the outside.
The fact that I can put both legs behind my head or do the splits doesn't make me a good person or a good yogi, it makes me a flexible body.
Remember this as you choose whom you'll admire and look up to on this platform.
Read their words, see their soul, and let the beautiful poses simply be the icing on the cake.
If you want to find true inspiration, and see who your favorite yogis really are, look deeper than the poses they practice. 💗 @fykiadaretreats

Sometimes I'm afraid to meet new people. Often, even. At least that's what I keep telling myself.
-
I tell myself that I'm socially awkward too...and that it can be contagious...that the awkwardness can spread, if I'm not careful, to whomever I'm talking with.
-
Maybe I've watched one too many Ted Talks lately, but I'm SO over these tired, old, and untrue limiting beliefs.
-
Here's a great question: How do you get rid of fear? Here's a simple answer: Practice doing what scares you! Even in small increments.
-
Im taking my own advice and I'm challenging myself to talk to strangers on this trip. A lot of strangers. And not just talk to them, but listen and connect with them too. So far, it's going amazingly well.
-
You know what this trip had shown me? Not only am I NOT awkward, but I actually love meeting new people! Surprise! 😃
-
I realize that I've been so busy telling myself how awkward and scared I am, that I haven't really been giving myself the chance to succeed in connecting with people. I realize that I need to get out of my inner dialogue and listen more. Seems like a good place to start.
-
This trip is challenging me in ways that I really didn't expect, and I'm feeling extra grateful right now. 😊

Everyone, meet @charlottetheyogi. I've never actually met her, but she managed to turn my whole day around today, and I want to thank her.

I'll just let the cat out of the bag: My relationship of the last 3 years has ended. It's mutual and we are going to stay friends, thank goodness, but I've been having good days and bad days nonetheless. I'm doing okay, but it's also been an emotionally challenging experience, so every bit of extra love and understanding helps.

This morning was not a good one. I was crying, and I didn't want to be crying anymore, so I decided to distract myself by checking my email (totally post-modern coping mechanism lol). The first one I opened was from @charlottetheyogi, and her email couldn't possibly have come to me at a more perfect time. I won't tell you what she wrote, that's between us, but I will tell you that by the end of her email, there were a lot of happy tears being mixed in and slowly crowding out the sad tears rolling down my cheeks.

Even though we've never even met, Charlotte took the time to write and send me a really meaningful message that impacted my whole day. She didn't owe me, a total stranger, any kind words or friendship, but she shared her love and shined her light on me anyway.

You never know what someone else is going through, and sometimes kind words to a stranger can change their day, week, month, or year. You could save a life with a timely compliment or smile, and never even know it.

Thank you Charlotte for your kind words and encouragement. I needed them. At one point, you wrote that I probably wouldn't see your email, but that it was worth it to you to send anyway. Well, I saw it, and I am truly grateful to you and inspired by your selfless kindness and love for someone you've never even met.

Like Charlotte did for me, without even knowing it, you have the power to change someone's sad tears to happy ones in the space of a simple act of kindness.

So go out there today, with Charlotte as your inspiration, and pay the love and kindness forward. Maybe go show @charlottetheyogi some love too. She's awesome and she deserves it. 😉❤️

Yesterday I spent a bunch of time walking around in the Newark Airport before my flight home.

I was in a happy mood and for once I was actually early for my flight and not feeling rushed. As I walked around, I looked at all the people I passed, and challenged myself to really see them.

I guess I must look at my phone and the ground a lot when I walk around, because I never realized how many people are searching for someone to connect with, even if it's just for a second.

I made real eye contact with so many people. I shared a genuine smile with each person whose eyes I connected with.
It was interesting to watch how different people reacted to this simple gesture of eye contact and a smile that meant "I see you and you are loved". When I smiled, some looked down or away, unable to let my smile in. Others gave me a really shy half smile back that seemed to say "I want to smile, but I'm afraid. I'm trying." The people who made me happiest were those who smiled back. Openly smiled back. Many of them looked like they had really needed that smiling moment with a stranger.
I could see the moment when they realized my smile was meant for them, followed by the moment when they decided to accept it and smile back, to connect with me.

Then a few people actually beat me to it. They smiled at me first. I accepted their smiles, grateful, and shared my own in return.

I always want to experience deeper connections, and this is one more way to practice being open to shared moments and connection...even if it's only for a couple seconds with a stranger walking past.

I challenge you to give this practice a try today. It's really simple. Look at the people you pass by throughout your day. Really see them. Make eye contact with them, and smile at them.
You never know when your smile might be just what someone else needed to find their own smile, so why not share it? ❤️😃

The first time that I ever saw this pose was when I looked at @nightmaretales feed. I've noticed that he is very vocal on Instagram, about this being his signature pose.
In this crazy global world of social media that we live in, posts can easily go viral. In the case of @nightmaretales pose, I've seen it popping up all over Instagram.

I'm curious how all of you feel about claiming ownership of poses. How far does it go?
In my experience, once something goes viral, it's almost impossible to control who posts it and whether they credit the source.

I struggle with this now and then with my photos, and with the hash tags of the challenges that I host. I can't control who hash tags their photos with the challenge hash tag...and sometimes we get some really random tags.
I'm often tempted to want to try to control who uses the challenge hash tag. I've tried a few times, but my efforts were fruitless.
I realize time and again, that once the challenge hash tag has gone viral, there's not a lot I can do. I feel for @nightmaretales, he created a really cool pose that is an awesome stretch and sensation.
This whole conversation also makes me think of the frequent court cases involving ownership of the Bikram Yoga sequence.

So, my question for all of you is this: how far do you think ownership of a pose or sequence goes?
I'm interested to hear your opinions on this topic. Please keep the conversation friendly and respectful.

Today I had a very important revelation, that I believe will seriously impact my overall and future happiness. This is big.

It all started when I put up a video of me practicing yoga this morning. I got a lot of beautiful comments, which I am very grateful for, but I also got some comments that made me very sad.

If you have been following me for a while, then you know that it really ticks me off people leave me comments telling me I'm too skinny, or that I need to "eat a cheeseburger". Comments like those make me sad and shake my confidence. I try not to let them, but sometimes I fail. I've always thought the problem was with the people leaving the comments. If only they would choose love instead of hate.

Today I realized the problem is with me. If I truly loved myself as much as I always say I do, these comments wouldn't even phase me. We can't change others' behavior, but we are all capable of changing the way that we react to it.

Instead of letting these comments get me down and discourage me, from now on I'm choosing to use them as motivation to love myself even more than I already do.
Thank you to all the haters for leading me to this realization. This experience has given me a newfound awareness that loving myself is a never-ending practice, one that must always be diligent about; especially in the face of negativity.

Now I will go back to enjoying the biggest strawberry margarita ever. Cheers! ❤️

Like a hangover, neither triumphs nor disasters last forever. 🙌🏻
So if your life is hard right now, breathe through it and keep going, because a moment will inevitably come when it doesn’t feel as challenging. And just the same, if your life is amazing right now, make the most of it, because a moment will inevitably come when it doesn’t feel as great. Life moves in waves, and we can only cherish the ups, learn from the downs, and keep going. 🔮
Lately I’ve been doing a lot of both, and I’m feeling tired and a bit wrecked. But everyday I keep going anyway, cherishing new moments, learning new lessons, and trying to stay grateful through it all (and to be honest, a lot of times failing at that last one, but that’s why gratitude is a practice 😉).

I got this tattoo on a 2nd date. It's one of the crazier decisions that I've made. I hadn't really been planning on getting one, but when the opportunity arose, I found myself saying yes. 🤷🏼‍♀️
I was considering getting Gypset on the other arm, but then I decided I could only commit to Goddess long term, and that one day I might really regret getting a tattoo of my Instagram name. 😂
Goddess seemed light and safe, like I wouldn't hate it in 50 years. 🙏🏻
The girl who tattooed me was what I would consider a hardcore tattoo girl. She had full sleeves, hand and neck tats, and what I perceived to be an intimidating, maybe even disapproving, set of facial expressions. 😑
I imagined she was judging me and thinking that my tattoo was lame and syrupy sweet. A bouncy blonde hippie yoga girl getting a "goddess" tattoo (insert imagined eye roll 🙄). I was sure she thought I was a poser. 😬
She finished my tattoo, and as I looked at it in the mirror, she stood next to me and said, nodding her head with approval, "That's a bad bitch tattoo."
"It is?!" I asked in a surprised voice? 😳
"Oh yeah," she told me, "this is your first visible tattoo, and you're proclaiming to everyone who sees it that you're a goddess. From one goddess to another, that's a bad bitch move." 😀
I left there feeling like a bad bitch in the best possible way, with an unexpected and newfound responsibility and drive to live up to this tattoo, this new mantra if you will. 💪🏻
Every time I see it, it's a reminder to say yes to life, not to make assumptions about others' thoughts and opinions, and to always proudly own the fact that I AM A GODDESS. 🙌🏻
To my goddesses and my bad bitches, from one to another, I see you, and I want you to always remember who and what you are. 🙌🏻🔥
Tag someone who could use a reminder. 💗

What kind of cheerleader are you for yourself? While we should all be our own biggest fans, I'm not always a very good cheerleader for myself, especially when life gets challenging.
.
If I'm being honest, every now and then I'm quicker to tell myself "You're not good enough" than I am to say "You're doing great. I love you."
.
For a long time, I've searched for someone to be my cheerleader, to love me the way I wished I could love myself. It has never worked out, which is for the best, because others will only love and respect you as much as you love and respect yourself.
.
I'm realizing that I do indeed deserve someone to sing my praises to the heavens, and remind me how lovable and amazing I am, but that the perfect person to play that role is me.
.
Whether you're feeling the team spirit or not. Be your own best cheerleader today and say "I LOVE YOU!" to yourself. Say it like you mean it, and if it doesn't ring true, keep practicing until it does. 💗
.

I’ve been thinking a lot lately, about how living in this image obsessed reality of ours can skew our understanding of what’s most important, and make it easier than ever to fall into the nasty game of comparison. 😒
.
I’m certainly guilty of letting this happen sometimes, and I can attest to the fact that comparison really is the thief that steals joy. ☹️
.
I naturally tend towards feeling somewhat insecure, and as much as Instagram has added to my life in positive ways, it’s also added to my insecurities. 😐
.
Thinking back on my life pre-gram, I realized that I’ve never spent as much time thinking about the way I look, and the way my life looks, as I have since I started seriously focusing on Instagram as a job a few years ago, and it’s starting to make me feel very tired of it all. 😴
.
Don’t worry, I’m not tired enough to leave this platform, but I am ready to change my thinking on the whole thing. Rather than being so focused on my face, my hair, the shape of my body, the lines in my yoga pose, or any other external feature of myself, I’m working actively on shifting my focus to the beauty on the inside... and it feels amazing. 🙌🏻
.
In a world that constantly fosters insecurities about the way we look, it’s time that I made a new goal for myself: MAKE MY HEART THE MOST BEAUTIFUL THING ABOUT ME. 💗
.
Now, who’s with me? Comment if you’re tired of the struggle of comparison and ready to love yourself from the inside out. 😃

Today's to-do list:
-Silence your inner critic.
-Quit overthinking and overanalyzing.
-Stop letting fear of others opinions inform your decision making process.
-Remember that perfection is an illusion, and the quest to attain it a futile one, so stop chasing it.

I woke up this morning and realized in some ways I've been unnecessarily making my life difficult for a long time. Too much rumination, and too little action, gave me time to create an intimidating laundry list of doubts and insecurities before I even started. I let fear of possible outcomes, and others opinions, paralyze me until I became afraid to try anything, and the list of doubts seemed never ending. Unfortunately, if fear of failure stops you from trying, it also stops you from succeeding.

Well, I'm over it. Perfection and too much care for the opinions of others are major buzzkills. I'm tired of being afraid to ruffle feathers, when a little feather ruffling sometimes can be a valuable experience for everyone involved to know themselves more deeply.

I'm tired of holding in my opinions and holding back parts of who I am for fear of judgment from haters and holier-than-thou wannabe yogis (yes, if you are one of those Uber-judgey people who thinks it's okay to be that way because you're "a yogi", then you heard me correctly, I did indeed just call you a wannabe yogi.) I'm not a perfect yogi by any stretch. In fact, I've ceased to identify myself as a yogi, because I find there's too much dogma around that word these days, and there is SO MUCH more to me than my yoga practice.

My breakthrough today came when I realized that those I was afraid of, the haters and holier-than-thou judges, are not, and simply never will be, my people. I don't need their love or acceptance. I need more of this. More posts like this.

Join me in being imperfect and reveling in the beauty of it. Let's be real. Let's be messy. Let's be politically incorrect sometimes. Let's be the lions who don't lose sleep over the opinions of sheep. Let's be weird. Let's be bold. Let's do the things that set our hearts ablaze with love and happiness, and quit caring so much what others think about any of it. ☀️
(📸: @zachallia)

I’ve shown this photo to several friends, and they all uttered the same adjective: “effortless.” 💆🏼‍♀️
.
I see how it looks that way, but I assure you I was feeling just about the polar opposite of “effortless” while in this position. My face may look tranquil, but it’s an illusion. I’m actually physically struggling here.
.
Social media is a lot like this photo. So many times we look at someone from the outside and see their pose, their life, their things, their relationship, or any other aspect of their life that we covet, as “effortless,” when in fact that is far from reality.
.
I’ve gotten some flack in my DMs for some of my less than positive posts from Tulum. They say that I’m a privileged white girl, and how dare I be anything other than happy when I’m in a place like this.
.
I may indeed be a privileged white girl, but like this pose, while it may appear that way, my life is far from effortless, perfect, or any other adjective you might assign without knowing better.
.
I don’t like to list my woes, but to give you a clue, I’m currently dealing with my psycho and unlawful landlord threatening me, a person attempting to commit insurance fraud against me for a car accident I wasn’t actually involved in, and BONUS yesterday my car was towed and impounded from the metered spot it was parked in during a yoga class. I had the privilege of coming out and having a real-life “Dude, where’s my car?!” moment.
.
It’s honestly all good. I recognize that if these are my biggest problems, in the big scheme of things, my problems aren’t very big. I have my health, I’m able to pay to get my car out of impound, and for lawyers to deal with both the insurance fraud and the psycho landlord. For all of this, I’m truly grateful. 🙌🏻
.
I’m not a victim. I’m not sharing this so that you feel sorry for me, or stupid for the DMs you sent telling me what a privileged asshole I am.
.
I’m sharing this with you, so that the next time you compare your pose, life, relationship, or anything else, to someone else, remember that looks really can be deceiving, and NOTHING is ever as effortless as it might look from the outside. 💗
.
📸: @britroseyoga // @aloyoga

So you guys are never going to believe what I was so afraid to do.... teach a yoga class in a studio!

Here's a little secret: until today I hadn't taught a studio yoga class in probably 3 years. Before that I was teaching A LOT, like 17 classes a week.

In the interim, I had an experience at a teacher training that traumatized me and convinced me I was a horrible yoga teacher. I literally felt like I was doing my students a disservice by calling myself a teacher.

My fear and insecurity overtook me and I stopped teaching large classes. My confidence was gone and I didn't feel good enough to stand at the front of that room.

During the last 3 years, I've taught online, led private sessions, hosted a retreat, and even filmed my own yoga TV show where I taught, but no large classes, because I was too afraid to teach a class with a real live students in front of me.. Well, now that's no longer true.

When one of my best friends @caleyalyssa's yoga teacher sub cancelled last minute, I had the choice to step up or let my friend down when she was in a bind. So I stepped up (amidst tears, trembling, and almost paralyzing fear of not being good enough). She found a sub after that and gave me the chance to let myself off he hook, but I refused. It was time to put this to bed once and for all. I was tired of carrying this heavy bag of fear and insecurity around with me.

Carrying my fear with me still, I went in there and ROCKED IT. Once I got into my groove, everything felt natural again and I wasn't scared. It was familiar and it felt like a sort of home. All that fear, all that insecurity, FOR YEARS!, and in the space of a leap of faith and a 75 minute yoga class, I found my confidence again.
I now have a new story to replace the old one: NOT ONLY AM I GOOD ENOUGH, BUT I AM A GREAT YOGA TEACHER! 😃

Photographing this pose was not easy, but it was a huge eye-opener. I had to shoot this photo several times, because each time there were alignment issues that I hadn't expected.

Before seeing some of my out takes, I believed that my chaturanga was flawless. Overconfident much Caitlin? LOL.
I have practiced for years to refine my alignment in this pose, and I thought that I had "conquered" chaturanga.
In the end, I got the photo that I was hoping for, but this whole experience was a wonderful reminder that no matter how hard I try, I can never and will never be able to "conquer" my yoga practice.
Furthermore, why would I want to? When there is nothing left to learn and no room to grow, life can feel empty, boring, pointless.

Even though my ego may want to "conquer" yoga, that would take all the fun out of it. I am happy to keep learning and practicing. When all is known, the magic is gone...and I love magic.

Keep the magic in your practice, even if it means sometimes recognizing that there is room to improve. ✌
That sunset though! ☀️✨🌙

One of the best savasana moments that I've ever experienced.
When I posted my last photo, a lot of you expressed that you would love to ride an elephant too. It was a beautiful experience that I will never forget. Certainly one not to be missed if you ever have the chance.
At the Four Seasons Tented Camp Golden Triangle, where I rode this particular elephant, the caretakers love their elephants and take extreme care to protect and respect them. The elephants live on a large, well-funded, and well-maintained sanctuary.
The sad truth is, that not all establishments are like this. I feel that it is my duty to encourage you to do you research on any elephant establishment, before supporting them with your business.

I don't like to inject negativity into any conversation, but I would be remiss in my inspirational duties if I were to post a photo, that makes you all want to ride an elephant, without also cautioning you to make sure to choose an establishment that loves and respects their elephants the way that all creatures deserve.

Practice love in all that you do. ❤
For real though. 😉

I find my true north when I quiet my mind to better listen to the songs of my heart and soul.

This is Tom Moses. He was our guide as we toured Robben Island, the island prison where Nelson Mandela served the majority of his prison sentence.
-
Tom served 11 and a half years of a 12 year sentence as a political prisoner in this same prison. One would think that after all of the time and hardship inside these walls, this would be the last place that he would ever want to return to.
-
Yet here he is, coming back several days a week as a guide, to share his stories and educate people like me on the inequalities and injustices that still exist in our world...as much as they are easy to forget in my comfortable, coddled, equal, and freedom-filled American life.
-
The most profound moment of this entire trip occurred during a conversation that I had with Tom. He told me that when he was released, he had fully forgiven his captors and the system of injustice and inequality that had landed him there in first place, for joining the movement to rebel against it.
-
I asked him how he found the power within him to forgive. His answer not only inspired me, but I felt it in my heart and my soul. It gave me chills. The kind of chills where the hair on my arms stands at attention, knowing that a profound moment is occurring.
-
Tom told me he knew that he must forgive fully, from his heart and his soul, for the sake of the country he loves. He explained that he, and the other leaders and members of the movement, knew that if they left prison carrying anger and hate with them, then that is the direction that they would lead the future of South Africa.
-
Tom and the others knew that they must lead and live from love, not hate, even if it meant truly forgiving the unforgivable, because they believed in their cause so wholeheartedly.
-
However, there was another, deeper, reason that Tom felt it necessary to forgive: because he knew that until he did, he would never truly be free. NOW THAT IS SERIOUSLY PROFOUND.
-
After our conversation, I will always remember that true freedom can be found often only in forgiveness. ✌🏻️❤️🇿🇦

I'm in the midst of one of the most challenging days I've had in a very long time.

So, I walked outside to get some air and just try to breathe through it.

I was greeted by this perfect little natural heart in the snow and I took that much needed breath. The corners of my mouth lifted into a shy and tentative smile (no teeth), but that's already an improvement.

Instead of focusing on my problems, I'm focusing on this heart in the snow. I'm focusing on love. There's a lot of love in my life. I'm grateful for the people I cherish and that I am often lucky enough to be cherished by them in return. I'm focusing on love instead of fear and it's helping me. Try it the next time sh*t gets heavy, I highly recommend it. 😉

Things are hard today, but tomorrow and beyond I have nothing but total faith that good things are coming. ❤️

New mantra: Thank you Universe for all the good things in my life that I don’t know about yet. 🔮🙌🏻

Kisses! 💋 These little girls were so cute, and I couldn't resist asking them to pose for a photo with me. My plan was to have them practice a yoga pose or sit in meditation with me, but they had other ideas.
-
I sat down to try to show them what I wanted, but they were more excited to hug me, kiss my cheeks, and braid my hair. The photo of this candid moment turned out to be more adorable and authentic than whatever I had been trying to create.
-
It's easy to get wrapped up, in this insta-universe I live in, in creating a beautiful photo, rather than a beautiful moment. I do my best, but sometimes I'm guilty of failing at this.
-
These girls reminded me again of a valuable lesson that I have already learned, yet failed to heed, many times, and it's simply this: the most important thing is not the yoga pose, it's not how we look to others, it's not making a perfect photo; the most important thing is connecting with others and experiencing life to the fullest, no matter what that actually looks like.
-
Grateful to these little girls for their hugs, kisses, hair braiding, and for their infinite wisdom. ❤️

Join me and some other @aloyoga yogis for 30 Days of Mindful Movement, a FREE 30-day series of 30-minute classes with me and some of Alo’s favorite yoga instructors - @andrew7sealy, @bohemian_heart, @caleyalyssa, @calvmonster, @joshkrameryoga, & @koyawebb as we guide you through four weeks dedicated to resolutions, energizing flows, strengthening moves and mindfulness to refresh and restart for the coming year.
.
Week 1: Resolutions—You’ll be encouraged to set an intention, do things differently and practice every day.
.
Week 2: Energize—New year, new vibes! Get ready to energize your body, mind and soul!
.
Week 3: Mindfulness—Be present, stay focused and use mindful movement as a gateway to better alignment with your intentions!
.
Week 4: Strength—Strong practice, strong heart. Stay committed to this month and you’ll definitely get all the feels.
.

3. BONUS: We’re giving away 10 mats & anyone who signs up gets the chance to win one!
.
4. COMMENT and TAG 3 friends you want to do this with below!

See the light, even in crappy situations.
Yes, I had some possessions,that I really cared about, stolen this morning, but I also have a lot to be grateful for in my life, like my health, my family, good friends, and good fortune (most of the time lol). I'm choosing to look at this experience as a wake-up call that maybe I was too attached to material things. I'm not a perfect yogi or a prefect human, but life is a practice of trial, error, and learning, and this experience is part of my practice too.

As angry as I am at the person who violated me and stole my things, I'm trying to let go of that anger and be grateful instead for the chance to deepen my connection to what really matters.

Always keep learning. Always keep growing. Always be grateful, especially when that seems hard to do.
Namaste ✌️

I’ve always wanted to be liked and loved by the people in my life, and I am, but I’ve also struggled with feelings of unworthiness or not being good enough.
.
Building an online persona has been a trippy experience. It gave me the chance to portray myself as a person that I thought everyone would like and love, even more than they liked and loved the real me.
.
As a person who has had many moments of wanting to be someone else, this ability to control how people saw me became intoxicating for a time.
.
Where I was weak, Gypset Goddess was strong. Where I was afraid, Gypset Goddess was fearless. Where I felt not good enough, Gypset Goddess always was.
.
It’s true, people do like and love Gypset Goddess, but the funny thing is that they never have ended up liking or loving her more than they do me.
.
When I would meet people who followed Gypset Goddess before they met me, their response 9 out of 10 times used to be this: you’re a lot cooler than I thought you would be.
.
For awhile this surprised me. How could they possibly like me better than Gypset Goddess (aka the better version of me)?
.
This kept happening until it dawned on me: Gypset Goddess was near perfect, and perfection is both unrelatable and boring. I thought that I needed to seem more “perfect” to be more likeable and loveable, but in fact, seeming more perfect made me less of both.
.
I decided to drop the facade and bring more of myself into my persona until they became one and the same. Instead of hiding my weaknesses and fears, I shared them.
.
A little bit of sharing turned into a lot, until I stopped hearing that I’m cooler than expected, and started hearing instead that I’m just as people imagined.
.
I created Gypset Goddess, because I thought that the real me wasn’t good enough or worth sharing, but the biggest lesson that I’ve learned is this: no persona that I could create is ever as cool, or as likeable, or as lovable, as I am already, just as I am.
.
The next time you’re thinking that you’re not enough, or wishing you could be someone else, remember this: you are already a likeable person, who is worthy of love, just as you are. Don’t change. 💗
.

Kind of afraid to share this, but here we go: I've been on a sabbatical from posting yoga videos, because the truth is, at some point, they stopped feeling like yoga for me.
Over the past couple years, filming my "practice" became harder as I got busy, got distracted, and started practicing less in real life. I say "practice", because often I was filming sequences for the purpose of posting them, not actually filming my home practice (which had become dormant).
It came to a head one day earlier this year, when, feeling pressure to come up with an engaging sequence, and choosing one that was ridiculously and needlessly complex for the purpose of getting more views, I literally found myself flipping off my yoga mat, because I was frustrated that I messed up the sequence I was trying to film, for what felt like the 50th time.
Unfortunately I have this on video, and maybe one day I'll share it as a cautionary tale. Suffice to say, I've been on a yoga video break since that day, and I was determined not to make or share another video until I was actually filming my yoga practice (not "practice") again.
I even stopped referring to myself as a yogi. I felt like a fake, and I was constantly worried that my fake image would shatter, and you would all find I wasn't practicing yoga as deeply as I sometimes made it seem.
Well, now I guess I've shattered that image myself, and it actually feels pretty great. There's a freedom in saying "fuck it" and sharing the things you feel most ashamed of.
For a while, I didn't know how to start being real again, because when your entire life has become filtered and curated, it's hard to peel those layers back...and it's scary to admit it when you haven't been being your most authentic self.
So I'll just start here, with this caption, a return to my home practice, and a return to the videos that built this page.
I feel peace and playfulness in my practice again, and in admitting all of this right here right now, in sharing my shame with you, I'm already starting to feel a lot more like a yogi again. 💗

I grew up around some seriously mean girls, and was actually afraid of my female peers for much of my life. Always expecting them to at best talk behind my back, and at worst stab me in it.
.
One of the biggest steps out of my comfort zone to date, has been to start trusting women to be my friends again, but it's a constant and sometimes difficult practice.
.
I had built up a wall to protect myself from unexpected betrayal and hurt feelings for so long, that even now I still sometimes notice the old automatic assumption popping up: that other women don't like me and that they are potentially planning to do something awful to me.
.
Viewing the world through that particular lens, you can probably imagine what I see, even if it isn't always actually there. Through that lens, other women need to be feared, as if they all have hidden backstabbing knives ready to use at any moment.
.
The hardest thing about feeling betrayed and living in the fear of betrayal, is that it forces you to sit back and question your own judgment at the end of the day. You thought that person was safe and trustworthy, but you were wrong, and then they hurt you. What now?
.
But then I started a new practice. Rather than living in fear, I actively decide to trust myself and others. Not the hippie "trust the universe" kind of trust, but a calculated and adult trust.
.
I've grown up now. I've learned to read people, recognize patterns, know myself, know the type of people I want close to me, and the type that I don't.
.
Through my new lens, I can see that the story I had told myself for so long, that women automatically hated me on site, is not and was never a true story. Turns out women can be incredible and supportive friends.
.
I share this with you, because all too often, we carry stories with us that we see as truths, even after they cease to be true... or never were true in the first place.
.
Check in with your stories, and see if you've moved beyond any of them (I bet you have!!). Maybe it's time to let one go. 💗
.

When my Instagram was hacked yesterday and almost deleted, I wigged out. My eyes were opened to how big a part of my identity @gypsetgoddess has become.
I was forced to ask myself: what would I do next if my account wasn't fixed? Who would I be if I wasn't @gypsetgoddess anymore? The answer was: I would still be me, Caitlin, and that's always enough.
Full disclosure: I didn't actually come up with that answer until my Instagram was restored...and that fact makes me uncomfortable, but my reaction helped me realize something really important:
I am not my job. I am not my social media presence. I am not my follower count. If all of those things were to disappear, I would be no less valuable as a person.
It's easy to become attached and even identify as our jobs, our circle of friends, our social media presence, or any number of things that we use to define ourselves, but we are all so much more than what we do, who we hang out with, or how many followers we have.
When things go haywire and you begin to doubt yourself, I'm here to remind you that you are enough. You are valuable. You are loved...and all of these things are true, simply because you are you. ❤️
-

In a city that moves about a million miles a minute, it’s been hard to adjust. I’m used to LA speed, where 10 minutes usually means about an hour. 😉
.
One is too fast, and one is too slow, and sometimes I’m not sure how to float in the middle of the two. 🤷🏼‍♀️
.
I’m starting to wonder whether I belong in either of these cities, and sometimes I feel scared...but that’s when the yoga and life experience kicks in. 🙏🏻🙌🏻
.
I used to run the other way as quickly as I could whenever these fearful feelings would rise to the surface, but now I just sit with them and breathe. 💆🏼
.
I breathe and I trust that everything is happening as it’s meant to, so that I can learn the lessons that I’m meant to learn. No need to act rashly, just breathe and take life as it comes, day by day. 🔮🤷🏼‍♀️💗
.

The first time, years ago, that I asked my dad for help taking some yoga photos for Instagram, he told me I was crazy. 🤷🏼‍♀️
He didn’t get it, but that was okay with me, because I figure: if no one thinks you’re crazy, you are not yet operating to the outer limits of your potential. 😜
Many others along the way, besides my dad, told me that this Instagram thing was crazy, but I kept on going, and look where it’s brought me... somewhere CRAZY awesome, where I get to love what I do more days than not. My dad didn’t get it back then, but he certainly does now. 🙌🏻
So, shoot for the moon, baby, and if anyone thinks you’re crazy, just say oh well, and keep trusting and believing in yourself. 🔥

This morning was a doozy. One of those mornings where nothing seems right in the world, and I was practically in tears (ok, I cried a little) by 10am. 😭
.
But then @britroseyoga, who was feeling it even more than me, said something that I really appreciated; and I want to share it with you. 💁🏼‍♀️
.
She said: “We just have to breathe through all of this. The universe is having a sense of humor today, and tomorrow will be a new day, no matter what.” 🙌🏻
.
It’s true what she said. No matter what, tomorrow WILL be a new day. And sometimes, the universe really does have quite a sense of humor. 🔮
.
I come from the school of thought, where it’s better to be laughed with, than laughed at, so I giggled. Despite everything that was going on, I decided to laugh with the universe. 😂
.
I may have looked like a crazy person, but it felt so good, that I didn’t care. 🤷🏼‍♀️
.
If the universe is having a sense of humor with you today, and it’s making you feel like shedding some tears, why not shed them laughing with the universe and remembering that tomorrow will be a whole new day? 🙌🏻
.
You might look as crazy as I did, but trust me, it’s worth a try. 😉
.

The walkway to my room at @thesaxonhotel is too beautiful to handle. I'm usually a fairly brisk walker (much to the chagrin of my friends with slightly shorter legs lol).
-
That being said, I can't help but walk slowly and mindfully down this walkway every time, hoping to savor it like a delectable dessert.
-
With each step I remind myself that I should always walk and, more importantly, LIVE mindfully, savoring the sweetness of life's joys and the savouriness of life's sorrows with equal pleasure, acceptance, and tenacity to keep going no matter what.
-
Easier said than done. Trust me, I know. But it's always worth a try, and more than that, it's worth a do. Grateful for this beautiful walkway and the mindful reminder it has provided me. ✌🏻️

With patience and practice come progress.
Two years ago I thought it was impossible for me to ever hold a handstand. Today, looking back, I see how silly I was for not believing in myself.

So many things that seem impossible are actually just difficult, and there is a HUGE difference between the two. Very few things in life are truly impossible, but many things in life are difficult.
It was difficult to learn how to hold a handstand. It took a lot of patience and a lot of practice, but it was never impossible.
The next time you tell yourself something is impossible, take a moment to consider whether that's actually true. Most of the time, it isn't true at all. 😀

Today I had a cool realization after I started the day by waking up on the wrong side of the bed. My realization came during a yoga class that I went to this morning.
There was a girl practicing next to me, who insisted on practicing handstands, out of sequence, for basically the entire 75 minutes of class.
While the whole class was winding down in pigeon poses and forward folds, she was still handstanding all over the place, dropping down into wheel or chaturanga and being REALLY loud about the whole thing. No soft landings here. Boom! Pow! She was distracting, and she was driving me crazy. Crazy, I tell you.
But here's what I realized. She wasn't driving me crazy. I was letting myself be driven crazy. It wasn't even about her, it was about me and the fact that I woke up on the wrong side of the bed.
Once I took a breath and checked myself, I realized I was being unfair. Who am I to judge the way that she was enjoying a yoga class that I chose to attend?
Instead, I focused on my breathing. The sound, the feeling, the experience of breathing, of being alive. I thought "there's so much in the world to be grateful for and happy about, and there isn't time to waste judging others." Right around the time I had this thought, I realized that I had inadvertently LET IT GO. The anger, the judgment, gone.

It felt good. I didn't even notice that she was there anymore, because I had switched my focus from the negative to the positive, from the outside to the inside.
Moments like this make me truly grateful for my yoga practice. Yoga poses are fun and awesome, but the real practice manifests in my everyday life and the way that I relate to the world around me.
Yoga has taught me to breathe through trials and tribulations and to be more compassionate. It's given me the awareness to check myself, on days like today, before I wreck myself.
To the handstander who may or may not have seen my eye rolls sent in her direction: I'm sorry for judging you. Your handstand skills are truly impressive and I just woke up on the wrong side of the bed. Thank you for helping me learn a valuable lesson. I am grateful for you... and your handstands. ✌️❤️😃

I left Arizona 3 years ago following a pretty difficult breakup, and I’ve been scared to come back to visit ever since. I feared that being here would make me feel sad, make me miss what I used to have, who I used to be with, and even who I used to be.
.
The first few days I was here, I stayed as busy as I could, so that I didn’t have much idle time to get stuck in my head. I went out of my way to avoid certain intersections from which I could see the house where we lived together.
.
But it turns out that my fears were entirely unnecessary. Since I’ve been here, I haven’t been sad and I haven’t missed my old life. In fact, it’s been just the opposite.
.
Being here has helped me realize that I love the person I am today, so much more than I ever loved the person I used to be.
.
Yesterday, I stopped avoiding those intersections. Instead, I gave the house a good hard look as I drove by, and to my surprise, I felt... free. The sadness and regret I had feared were nowhere to be found, and it was such a liberating feeling.
.
I thought I would come here and be aware of what I didn’t have anymore, but instead I’ve been aware of what I DO have, and that I wouldn’t change a thing.
.
For 3 years, I’ve been missing out on seeing my friends here, and on the chance to allow myself moments of validation, as I see how much I’ve grown since I was here last.
.
Well, all of that stops now. I’m not afraid to visit anymore, because in coming here, I’ve been reminded of how much I love this place and the people in it.
.
If there’s a place you’re afraid to visit, because of past experiences there, I urge you to face your fears and go there. Make new memories. Have new experiences. Reclaim that place! Don’t ever let fear of confronting your past, keep you from enjoying your present. 💗
.
📸: @lifeinabeachtown / @cleobella

Celebrate. Everyday. Today I'm celebrating my first real hand-to-hand!

I've always been so afraid to practice hand-to-hand balancing. Afraid to fall, afraid to get hurt.

A little fear is healthy and natural, it's just part of the human condition and it keeps us safe.

However there is a difference between healthy fear and imagined fear. My fear surrounding hand-to-hand was a mix of both.
I have the skill to practice this, but there is also risk involved. In this case, the skill to risk ratio was less scary in reality than it was in my head.

I know my limits, but I also safely practice leaving my comfort zone sometimes. This helps me feel the whether my fears, surrounding anything, are real and valid or imagined and untrue.

What have I learned? I've learned that I have far more imagined fears than valid ones.
Thanks @acrowithjon for helping me rise above my fears. Literally. Also, big thanks to @becksamillion who is killing it on the rings in the background. 😃 Song; "I Just Want To Celebrate" by Rare Earth 🎶
Really glad I stayed. Sometimes you have to disconnect to reconnect. ✨

I just made some super yummy green juice!
Want to try it? Here is the recipe that I just made up from what I had in my refrigerator:

4 kiwi
1 Bartlett pear
1/2 cup green grapes
1 cucumber
1 handful spinach
1 handful parsley
1 head kale
1 head romaine lettuce
1/2" cube ginger
1.5 c coconut water

Makes 4-5 cups.

Give it a try and let me know what you think. It's more fun to drink your veggies than it is to eat them! 🍹

Channeling my inner teenager. 😜

When I was 16, I was an elite level rhymthmic gymnast, and stuff like this was easy. It's definitely NOT easy (at all), now that I'm a little older and less flexible... in fact, getting into this one took longer than I'd like to admit 😂... but I choose to let moments like this one remind me of something very important: I've still got it! 😉
.
My head no longer touches the back of my standing leg (it's true), and I may be less flexible and more jiggly in some areas than my teenage self (such is life), but I'm also stronger, wiser, more sure of myself than teenage me ever could have imagined feeling, and... bonus... I finally grew the boobs that teenage me always wanted. 😂
.
Comparing yourself to a younger you can be depressing if you let it, or it can be reaffirming and kind of awesome. It's all about where you choose to place your focus. ✌🏻

When life gets crazy, all of a sudden my ability to find my peace becomes really important. I can go to classes everyday, hold a handstand for sixty seconds, but the truth is, I never know if my practice is working until I’m tested. 🔮
I feel my yoga working when I’m angry, or sad, and I breathe through it without acting rashly. 🙏🏻
I feel my yoga working when I feel like my life is out of control, but then I remember I can always control my breath. 🙏🏻
I feel my yoga working when I feel like I’ve got nothing more to give, to myself or anyone else, and I love myself enough to rest, without feeling guilty for needing that. 🙏🏻
When do you feel your yoga working? 💗

How's your Saturday going? The sun is out and so is my smile (both have been hiding lately), so I guess you could say my Saturday is going pretty fabulously. 😃

Achieving lotus pose while upside down is a challenge for me. Sitting right side up it's a breeze, but upside down not so much. For a long time I couldn't even get my legs into the pose.

With lots of practice, I'm finally making some progress, but I'm still not that steady. One of my goals is to be able to hold a lotus handstand, but every time I try it, I fall. Even so, I keep smiling and I keep practicing.

Yoga isn't about the destination, it's about the journey. It's fine to be excited to arrive at your destination, but make sure you enjoy the journey there and don't rush the process.

Progress comes with patience and practice. Let it flow. 🌊🌊

Words for your Wednesday: The grass isn't greener on the other side, it's greener where you water it. This truth can be applied to everything. You're welcome. 😉 @aveda
