Happy birthday Neila! 🐶💗👑🎂
This little lover has been my partner in crime and best friend in the world for the last 13 years.
We've lived together in Michigan, Arizona, Texas, France, and California.
Neila has been there to celebrate the happiest times, and also to cuddle with me when life brings tears instead.
She has watched me make some crazy (and sometimes even wrong) decisions, but she's never judged me, and she's stuck with me through them all.
She's lived with me in run-down apartments with each wall a different color, in mansions on mountaintops, and places in between.
Wherever we find ourselves, she always has a way of reminding me that it's not about where you live, or what you have, but about who you live there with and what you do.
You could even say she's saved my life a few times, and it wouldn't be an exaggeration.
Thank you for making my life so much happier, and bringing your unique brand of wisdom and positivity to my life and my community. I love you Neila! 💗

When I film my yoga flows, I usually speed them up about 10x before posting. ☄️
.
I do this to fit more flow into the 1 minute time limit, but also because the speed of the video conceals any minor wobbles or imperfections in my movements. 🙈
.
Well, I’m tired of hiding my imperfections, both on the mat and off. So, here’s me breathing and flowing, in real time, with any wobbles fully visible. 👋🏻
.
Of course these are only my own opinions, they’re in no way the law of the land, but I believe that yoga’s not about looking perfect on the outside. It’s about feeling good, inside AND out, enough that the wobbles cease to matter, because you realize it’s not really about the wobbles, or the lack there of.m either. 🙌🏻
.
So, I guess I’m posting this to see what you’ll all do. To see if you’ll still love my post, minor wobbles and all, without the fancy editing or music, when I’m just showing up as myself and doing what feels good. I really hope you do, but no matter what, I’m gonna keep on flowing. 🙌🏻
.

I get a lot of comments on here about my legs. “Legs for days!” or “I wish my legs were that long!” And they always kind of make me chuckle, because the truth is, for the longest time, I hated my legs. 🙅🏼‍♀️
.
Growing up, I thought they made me look gangly, and finding a pair of pants that were long enough was a serious mission. ☹️
.
My private school skirts, which had to be at most exactly 3 inches above the knee, were always fit for a grandmother, while other girls with shorter legs had the cutest short skirts. 👵🏻
.
These days, I’ve learned to love and appreciate my legs for their grace, flexibility, and power... and even for their ability to reach from the ground to the ceiling in some spaces. 🙌🏻
.
They’re still as long as they always were, but I’ve shifted my perspective in the way that I view them. 😍
.
My point in sharing this is, to remind you that when people look at you, they often see your beauty rather than your flaws. Believe it or not, they also often see the beauty IN your flaws. 😍
.
So the next time you find yourself wishing you were more like someone else, remember that there is someone out there wishing they were more like you. 💗
.
📸: @lifeinabeachtown

This is a cool surprise! Feeling larger than life...literally! 😃
.
A few years ago, I got kinda down on myself for not having done anything "Google-worthy." LOL.
.
Seems like a funny thing to get frustrated about, but it wasn't about feeling unseen or unpopular (if you know me, then you know I tend to be an introvert, so popularity isn't my motivation. 😊)
.
What bothered me, was that I felt as if I hadn't contributed anything to the world worth searching for, and I wanted to change that.
.
I didn't quite know what I wanted to contribute when this all started, so I just did the only thing I could think of: pursue my passions, live a life that makes me happy, share it with others, and figure the rest out along the way, never doubting that I'd make it work one way or another.
.
Well, now you can find me on Google... and, thanks to my bffs at (my fave!) @aloyoga, you can find me on the 3rd St. Promenade in Santa Monica. 😳 Take it from me: your crazy wishes and dreams are valid, never stop believing in them! Your lofty goals are attainable, keep pursuing them!
.
There have been lots of ups, downs, and learning experiences (both pleasant and unpleasant) on this weird journey of making it all up as I go, but the one thing that never wavers and never changes is my gratitude for ALL OF YOU. Yes, YOU! 🙏🏻

If I had to pick my favorite time of day to practice yoga, my answer would definitely be sunset.
After a long productive day, I love to connect with my breath, move my body around to release any leftover energy, and fully take in the transition from day to night, before I go about the rest of my evening.
Even if it's just a few quick sun salutations, I do my best to enjoy a bit of sunset yoga every day. Partaking in simple daily rituals, like this one, helps me to feel like the healthiest me ever.

I haven't practiced a lot of AcroYoga, but every time I have the chance to fly, I take it. For me, every AcroYoga experience is a metaphor and a life lesson.
In order to fly, you must be able to rise above the fear of trusting another person. It can be scary, but it can also help you grow in leaps and bounds.
I sometimes have trouble trusting others, so every AcroYoga experience is a scary and rewarding challenge. Even if I fall, then the practice changes from trusting someone not to drop me, to trusting that same person to catch me.
Here you see me finding freedom in flight, and trusting a complete stranger that I met 10 minutes before this photo was taken. Scary, but also very liberating.
Do something that scares you today and experience trust, whether that means trusting yourself or trusting someone else. When you rise above your fears, freedom waits on the other side of the experience. 😃

Big thanks to Honza and Claudine of @yogabeyond for first inspiring me to take flight. I think of you both every time I'm up in the air and smiling. ❤️

There are many who believe that the sole purpose of the physical asana yoga practice is to prepare the body to be able to sit in meditation.
With that in mind, after 30 days of physical asana yoga practice, I think we are all prepared to sit.
Sit in lotus, sit cross-legged, sit however you wish, just sit. And meditate. Do it for 30 seconds or do it for 30 minutes, whatever feels right to you. Please take a moment to reflect on your experience over the past month.

Yoga breakthrough time!! 😃 (keep reading ⬇️)...
.
I'm quite aware of, and respectful of, my limits...and yet I'm beginning to wonder if my "limits" are actually more like limiting beliefs.
.
I've always considered this pose FAR beyond my limits. SO far beyond them in fact, that I told myself "I can't" without ever actually giving it a try.
.
Today I got inspired to give the "impossible" a try, and it turned out to be completely possible...I even surprised myself and navigated my way into this pose without very much trouble.
.
The moral of the story? Don't give up and don't listen to the fearful voice in your head telling you "I can't"! At least flip that old script to "I might be able to."
.
This experience begs me to ask the question of myself and all of you: in what areas of your life have you been telling yourself "I can't" without even trying?✌🏻️

Each day is filled with endless possibilities and chances to start or continue living the life that you want to lead. Get out there and make today the kind of day that makes you feel grateful to be alive. ❤️

For much of my life, I haven't felt sexy. Pretty? Cute? Sure. But not sexy.
.
I'd go out with my friends and feel like their skinny little sister tagging along. I'd wear 👙 at the beach, but make sure I had a wrap to hide my lack of curves.
.
For years, until recently, I had stopped posting 👙 photos after I got too tired of all of the "No ass" and "You're anorexic" comments. What's worse is that these comments mostly hurt, because on some level I agreed with them that I looked unhealthy. I felt helpless, because I believed I couldn't change my body and create curves that weren't naturally there.
.
Then about 6 months ago, I challenged myself to step up and improve my body and my self image. While I love practicing yoga, my yoga practice alone wasn't helping me to build the muscle I wanted (and, let's be real, the 🍑).
.
I started strength and resistance training 3x per week with @mrindestructible99, in addition to my yoga, and I'm blown away by the impact that it's had on my body and my self esteem.
.
There have been many days I wanted to cancel, but I force myself to keep going, and tell myself that this is worth the time, energy, and hardship, because the alternative is continuing to feel self conscious and being afraid to wear bikinis.
.
When I saw this photo for the first time, I thought to myself "Oh no, you can't post that. It's too sexy." That thought stopped me in my tracks, as I was used to the narrative being "Oh no, you can't post that. You look anorexic."
.
And that's when it hit me: I am succeeding in not only improving my body, but my self image as well. It's moments like this that get me through the days when I want to cancel, and on those days, I remind myself how grateful I am to feel healthy, sexy, capable, and confident.
.
The moral of the story is this: don't ever believe you're stuck with the hand you've been dealt. Love yourself as you are, of course, but if there's something that makes you feel self conscious, love yourself enough to work to improve it. It's certainly not easy to improve things about ourselves, and even harder to change the way we see ourselves, but take it from me, it's always worth the effort. 💗
.
👙: @toripraverswimwear

It's funny how time becomes relative the more time I spend on the road. We all felt a little lost and ungrounded the other day, with no plans of where to stay or what to do after our plans fell through.

Scottsdale was only 5 hours away, and even if it's not home anymore, it sure still feels like it, and I think we all needed to feel home again for a day. So, to Scottsdale we went.

The funny thing is that I told myself "Scottsdale is ONLY 5 hours away." LOL! Had you asked me 2 weeks ago if a place that takes 5 hours to drive to is far away, I would have told you it might as well be moon.

After this time so far on the road, sometimes driving for up to 10 hour stretches, 5 hours seemed like a blink of an eye or the snap of a finger. ONLY 5 hours almost felt like a luxury.

This trip has reminded me that time really is relative, and can feel as slow or as fast as I decide to perceive it. ✌🏻️❤️🚐

Flow through your day like water. 🌊🌊🌊

Today I woke up in a funk and was having trouble shaking it off. I always try to look on the bright side of life, but sometimes the sun just refuses to shine...and that's okay. That's real life.

As yogis we so often shun and repress negativity in favor of always practicing positivity, but without negativity to compare to, positivity would have no meaning. Remember that on the low days.
It's okay to feel low sometimes. It's normal. Don't judge the feelings or yourself, don't put too much meaning to it. As with your least favorite yoga pose, sometimes all you can do is sit in it, sit with it, and breathe through it.

When I practice yoga, I'm actually practicing life, learning valuable lessons and skills, like how to breathe through challenging moments, that positively impact my life both on and off the mat.
If sitting with your unpleasant feeling, and breathing through it fails to help, (which, let's be honest, sometimes happens) you can always reach out to family or friends for a pick me up.
Grateful to @holographicsaraswati for listening and supplying awesome advice, and to @caleyalyssa for getting me off the couch and into matching outfits in the backyard for some
Strive to achieve balance and you will create peace from within. ✌

My trainer @mrindestructible99 created this sequence for me and I love it. 10 minutes, 5 exercises, and it sets my core on fire! 🔥
.
10x Plank - Forearm Plank
10x Plank Leg Lifts (front + side)
10x Plank Arm + Leg Lifts
10x Side Plank Leg Lifts
10x Superman Lifts
10 sec. Hold Superman
(Don’t forget to do both sides!)
.
If you have a spare 10 minutes, give this one a try and let me know what you think. 💗

There’s something to be said for an expansive view (both in life, and in terms of the view that you see with your eyes).
When I lived in Arizona, I lived in a house on a mountain, and I took the view for granted almost everyday. It would take the most epic sunset ever to get me to notice what was right in front of me, and only shooting stars seemed to remind me to feel grateful for it.
Ever since I moved, I’ve felt drawn to mountains, high rises, and basically any elevated place, but really, I was drawn to the views that such vistas afford.
When I look out, I see so much room to fill with possibility. I feel as if I have so much space to think and grow. I notice I can breathe again, when I didn’t even realize I had stopped.
If you have the time, go and find a view today. Even if you have to climb stairs, a tree, or anything else to get there. Even if you can only go there in your mind. Go anyway.
Give yourself the space to think and breathe, and see what happens. ✨
Find some time to relax today. 😃

The season is changing, and so is everything else. 🍁🍂🥀
Sometimes all the changes make me feel like I’ve got no control of anything, and it scares me, but then I take a deep breath, and am reminded that I can always control my breathing. 💆🏼
I walk outside for another deep breath, and I’m reminded that I control where I go and when I go there. 💃🏼🚲🚗✈️
Of course I can never control all of the things that happen to me, there will always be surprises in life, but I can control the way I view the world and interact with it. 🙋🏼🙅🏼
Sometimes I feel like I have to figure it all out, right this second, but then I take another deep breath, and remember that it’s ok not to know everything all the time. 🤷🏼‍♀️
For now, I’m just gonna keep trusting the signs, and manifesting the good things that I know are coming. I’m sure it’ll all make sense when I look back later on. 🔮🙌🏻💗

This was definitely my favorite yoga video that I made in 2016, mostly because of what was going on in my life at the time. ✨
When I made this one, I was staying with @aribarra in NYC, and my personal life was pretty messy following a series of unfortunate events.
I hadn't felt like practicing yoga in far too long, let alone filming my practice. Then one day, while I was alone in Alexa's apartment, feeling sorry for myself, I decided I couldn't be stagnant for another minute. Everything in me screamed that I needed to move my body. I needed to flow again.
I got up off the couch, and just started playing around, not feeling up to an organized practice. Before I knew it, I realized I was actually having fun, and then I made this video.
Just like that, from a very low place, my inspiration and drive returned. I felt like I could breathe again. At the end, you can see how happy I am, mostly because in that moment I stopped feeling so sad for a little while. Oh the magic of yoga.
Watching this video, from my current happy life place, and remembering how I felt that day, reminds me that no matter how sh*tty things seem at the time, life will get better, and then I will enjoy looking back and seeing how far I've come. 💗

Being shady near AstroTurf covered walls at Graceland. See the evidence of

Stop and enjoy the view a few times today. No matter what you're looking at, practice finding beauty in whatever you see or remember.

Beauty hides in unexpected places sometimes. There is beauty in chaos, beauty in the death of leaves as the seasons change. There is beauty in mistakes, beauty in scars, beauty in memories of that time you learned something new through pain.
There was pain in falling and scraping my chin while learning to ride a bike. I still have the scar to prove it, but when I look at the scar, I don't remember the pain of falling. I remember the beauty of the experience. I remember the joy of spending time with my dad and the thrill of the wind whipping through my hair as I pedaled as fast as I could.
Beauty is everywhere, if you choose to see it. Sure, the world is a crazy place where lots of things happen that are categorically NOT beautiful, but there's beauty in the balance of bad things happening to remind us to be present and cherish the good times even more when we have the chance.

Look for beauty in the world, even when it seems like it's hiding. ❤️

Thank you so much for all of your suggestions for what to do about my altitude sickness yesterday! I was feeling so awful, that I tried as many of your remedies as I could.

Here are the ones that I tried:
-rested
-drank a ton of water
-bought oxygen can from @rei
-drank coconut water
-mixed chlorophyll into my smoothie
-ate a carb rich meal
-took some @rescueremedyusa
-put extra salt on my food (Himalayan)
-a little peppermint oil along my hairline
-drank an herbal detox tea
-got rid of the Gatorade
-took a little Ibuprofen
-took a magnesium supplement
-took an iron supplement
-drank some coca tea from @wholefoods
-practiced pranayama
-went to a restorative yoga class
-ate some raw unheated honey
-had an at-home spa night with @sp__cecase
-distracted myself with good conversation

I tried so many things that I'm not really sure what helped the most, but I do know I'm feeling way better today!

Thank you again for sharing your great advice and helping me find such awesome natural tools to help my body feel better. ❤️

I am very analytical, and most of the time, I like this about myself. Being a consummate over-thinker and over-analyzer helps me to know and understand myself, my motivations, and my actions, and to often read other people and situations like books. 🤓
Once I've analyzed something, I use that information and understanding to make decisions, communicate my way to the heart of the matter, problem-solve, and generally succeed at the things I set out to accomplish. 💪🏻
It's reasons like these, that make me feel grateful for my analytical mind. But lately I'm becoming more aware of the ways that this same quality also succeeds at often taking the elements of fun and surprise out of life. 😔
I figure I'm already an expert analyst, so recently I've been challenging myself to STOP analyzing everything... and it's not easy. 😬
I'm constantly tempted to fall back on my ability to analyze, but I've realized that if I analyze and try to predict everything, then I'm also tempted to try to overly control the outcome. 🤔
That is maybe the root of all of this, and that's when life stops being surprising or fun, but instead becomes a futile struggle for control. This leaves a lot of space for disappointment, and chances to be reminded that I can never truly control anything except myself.... But here I am, over-analyzing myself again. As you can see it's easy for me to fall off the wagon. 🤷🏼‍♀️😂
However, all this thinking brings me back to my original practice: to STOP and remind myself that it's in the moments, when I stop over-thinking and over-analyzing, that I can be truly present to all of the magic, fun, and surprises that life has to offer. 😃
We each have a constant cycle that moves between being present and being in our minds, and that's life, but today I challenge you to stop thinking so much and let the magic in. 💗
.

Here in Tulum, I’ve been forced daily to confront my demons, and acknowledge blind spots that have been tripping me up.
.
I’ve been hesitant to share the past few days, because I feel that the captions I’ve tried to write might scare you away.
.
Sure, you love my light, but will you stay if my shadow enters the room with us? Or will it scare you away? Let’s see. Here’s the caption I was afraid to share today:
.
I often use anger to take my power back from someone who has stolen it from me (or maybe I’ve even given it to them). It feels like it works in the short term, but it never really does.
.
As sweet, vulnerable, and loving as I am, believe it or not, I can be incredibly scary when I choose to. The same power I use to instill love in people, can also be used to instill fear, and fortunately or unfortunately, I’m extremely effective at both.
.
Sometimes, getting angry and instilling fear in someone almost feels like an effective way of taking my power back from them. But the problem is, when I do this, I also give something priceless away: my peace.
.
What I’m learning is, if I really want to take my power back, I’ve got to take it back by loving even more and fearing even less. But damn, is that ever easier said than done.
.
If I want to take my power back, and keep my peace intact, I have to be the bigger person: the one who forgives, the one who accepts responsibility for my role, and the one who sleeps soundly at night, because I’m at peace with myself, my life, and the people in it.
.
Sure, getting angry and spreading fear and sadness when I feel wronged, can sometimes (in a messed up way) feel like a win, but when I can’t sleep later that night, it starts to feel more like a loss.
.
Remember that we’re all just doing our best, and everyone makes mistakes. So forgive yourself, and then do your best to forgive whoever it is that you feel has wronged you.
.
True power comes from the ability to control yourself and your reactions. To know that you can choose to change your current state of being, and instead embrace a different feeling.
.
When you master that, no one can take it from you... at least that’s what I keep telling myself. 💗
.

Life is such a trip right now. So many things are coming together and so many things are falling apart in the very same moment. The bad is really bad, but the good is REALLY good.
That's life though right? Always filled with polarities to make us appreciate the difference between and value of each emotion in the human spectrum. How could we ever truly appreciate the good without something to compare it to and give it meaning and value?
I'm just taking things one day at a time, accepting that everyday will be different than the last, and focusing on all the things I'm grateful for.
I'm breathing through the major ups and downs, allowing the good to balance (and let's be honest, overpower) the bad, and making sure to take full advantage of every chance I get to genuinely smile.
Today's mantra: Sh*t's crazy, but in this moment, given the chance, I wouldn't change a thing. I'll take all of it, the really good and the really bad, because I know I'm learning, growing, and getting stronger as a result of every experience. ❤️

The Instagram realm is an interesting world. In this realm, all we have to go off of are our own narrow perceptions of others.
When we make judgments about another person, based off of their Instagram posts; it is important to remember that these judgements are not based on truth or experience, they are based simply on YOUR perception.
We each have our own unique worldview that we use as the basis for all of our decisions. As a result, you may or may not understand/agree with my decisions, just as I may or may not understand/agree with yours. Neither of us are wrong, neither of us are right.

My decisions make sense to me, because I view them through my worldview. Your decisions may or may not make sense to me for the same reason: because I am viewing them through MY worldview and you are viewing them through YOURS.

Until we see through the eyes of others, until we live with their worldview, who are any of us to judge? Before you judge, and especially before you comment and share your judgement with the world, consider that you probably don't have all of the facts and also that you have no place to judge others in the first place.

Case in point: my backless (not frontless) nude mesh and sequin bodysuit. I found it interesting that I felt compelled, in my first few posts, to share with you that I WASN'T topless.
Why? Because I was afraid that some of you would judge me, leave rude comments, or unfollow me. Lame.

This morning, I posted another photo of the bodysuit without the disclaimer that "I'm NOT topless." Naturally, I immediately got comments asking why I'm topless, where my top is, etc.
I AM in fact wearing a top here, but even if I wasn't that would be OKAY too.
Want to know what I love most about Burning Man? The fact that there is NO judgement there, and ANYTHING GOES.
I could be naked or I could be wearing the weirdest outfit you could possible conceive of, but I would still be free of judgement and deserving of love, respect and acceptance. "Normal" society could learn a thing or two from the inherent values of freedom, self-expression, respect, and acceptance in the Burning Man culture. Just sayin'. ✌❤🔥
I am seriously going to miss this. One week wasn't enough, but I still had a ton of fun! ✌❤😃

I'm giving a big talk this Thursday at an event (think Ted talk, except it's not actually a Ted talk), and the topic is based around my social media journey, and how it has impacted my ability to be vulnerable and authentic, both on and offline.
I'm sharing a collection of my own experiences, and telling my own stories, which seems like it should be simple enough... yet I'm having the hardest time getting it down on paper.
I find that sometimes as soon as I know that other people will read what I'm going to write, hear what I'm going to say, or see what I'm going to do, then nothing I could write, say, or do, seems good enough anymore. Have you ever felt this way?
As I've been trying to write this talk, I've become aware of how often I hit this wall of fear of not being good enough... and it's more often than I'd like to admit. For someone who has as many followers as I do, this probably sounds odd, but believe it or not, I'm a little afraid to be seen. You know, really seen, in all of my vulnerable and authentic glory.
That's actually why I said yes to giving this talk, even though in doing so, I made my stomach drop and my heart feel as if it was about to jump out of my body. That physical reaction, that visceral fear, reassures me that I've boarded an unstoppable train moving fast in the direction of personal growth.
But first, I have to write it, which I've been attempting to do all day. Tired of banging my head against the metaphorical wall, and sore from too much sitting, I decided to take this stretch and flow break before the sun set this evening, bringing me 1 day closer to Thursday.
Enjoy this video, and wish me luck. 💗

I had an awesome conversation tonight with a friend who expressed that he was afraid to put himself out there on social media for fear of encountering haters.
My advice ended up inspiring us both, so I figured I'd share what I said to him with all of you too. We were texting, so you get my exact words (pardon my slight potty mouth lol 😊). Here is how I look at haters:
"Haters are a b*tch, but you practice believing and knowing they're full of sh*t, because YOU KNOW WHO YOU ARE. Then one day the practice becomes the automatic reaction, and the haters empower you, because they only serve as a reminder of how awesome you know you are.
It's a challenging practice, but it makes you stronger and even more sure of who you are and how valuable your contribution to the world really is...and THAT is super empowering.
When people diss you, your art, or something you passionately believe in, it sucks...there's no way around that. You can either believe them, or know they're wrong and channel it into a motivation to prove just how wrong they are.
Got haters? Channel their hate into fuel for your own cleverness and creativity, and go do something epic with that fuel. Instead of letting haters disempower you, know deep down how amazing and irreplaceable you are, and be empowered by that knowledge."
Feels incredible to be home...even if only for 36 hours. I forgot how amazing Michigan is in the summertime. 🏡 = ❤️

Are forearm balances and handstands scary for you?

Where is this fear really coming from?

For me, the fear was always from the thought of falling and hurting myself.

Once I learned to fall safely, I wasn't afraid anymore. With the absence of fear of falling, I began to progress far more quickly.

The key: become comfortable in forearm wheel and full wheel pose.
If you find yourself flipping over, just keep your arms solid in forearm stand and keep your elbows straight in handstand. Bend your knees and simply land on your feet in forearm wheel or full wheel.
If your arms stay strong, your feet will always hit the floor before your head.

It can be a little scary at first, but learning how to fall into wheel can change your entire outlook on inversion balances.

Use the addition of this new knowledge to subtract fear of inversions from your practice. When you're ready, get upside down and let yourself fall.
Oh yes, and of course, please enjoy this video of me falling... Twice. ✌❤😃

We got a flat tire on a deserted desert road, on a 100+ degree day, AKA one of my biggest road trip fears.

It's times like this when my yoga practice becomes handy for life outside of the studio. I took one deep and shaky breath, and went into problem solving mode.

I'm lucky enough to be with 2 fellow yogis, who did the exact same thing as me. We worked as a team, and what started as a scary experience turned into a memorable and fun one.

We laughed, played car trunk Tetris (we won), and meditated in the middle of the road, because we could.

The flat tire may have slowed us down, but it enriched our trip in ways that an efficient and obstacle-free ride never could have. ✌🏻️❤️🚐
Blue skies, blue water and smooth sailing all the way. ⛵

I woke up today reminiscing about the past. Here's a little secret about me that I don't talk about very often: I had a really hard time growing up.
For much of my childhood and teenage years, I was bullied and hurt. From 5th grade to high school, I switched schools 3 different times as a result.

It was hard. I cried a lot. I felt unlovable, uncool, and unworthy of friendship. I carried these feelings with me, in a heavy backpack, all the way into my 20s. Even into last year.
Even as I found true friendships, and experienced the sensation of being loved, even as a lot of people on Instagram and in my life decided I'm "cool", I still told myself the same story: you are unlovable, you are uncool, and you are unworthy of friendship.

I've grown and I've learned a lot since I started telling myself that sorry old story. For so long, I thought that the solution was to be someone other than myself, someone who was lovable, cool, and worthy of friendship. I was wrong, and all of you, my InstaBuddies, all of you played a role in helping me see that.

Instagram is a trip. Admittedly, a part of it has been a continuation of the search for the acceptance that I've always yearned for. I've used it as a testing ground to find out what resonates with people and what doesn't, and which version of me resonates and which doesn't.
What I found is that the only version of me that ever resonates with you guys, or anyone else, is the real me. What resonates more than the "cool" me, is the authentic me. The vulnerable me. It's in being honest, authentic, vulnerable, and fearlessly myself, that I feel lovable, cool, and worthy of friendship.
All of your likes, comments, and feedback (positive and negative) have helped me learn a lesson that I've been trying to learn for my entire life: Want to know the easiest way to be lovable, cool, and worthy of friendship? BE UNABASHEDLY, UNAPOLOGETICALLY, YOURSELF.
I can tell you from research and experience, that YOU are what makes YOU lovable, cool, and worthy of friendship. Anything less is unacceptable. ❤️ Photo cred: @justinbastien 📷

There are many who believe that the sole purpose of the physical asana yoga practice is to prepare the body to be able to sit in meditation.
With that in mind, after 29 days of physical asana yoga practice, I think we are all prepared to sit.
Sit in lotus, sit cross-legged, sit however you wish, just sit. And meditate. Do it for 30 seconds or do it for 30 minutes, whatever feels right to you. Maybe take a moment to reflect on your experience over the past month.

This was by far my favorite Yoga Bliss filming location. Practicing yoga so close to a huge waterfall was a really magical experience.

Sometimes I would get nervous while filming, and it made it difficult to stay with my breath and stay present in my practice.
Practicing with the natural soundtrack of the running water from this waterfall helped me remember to stay calm, breathe, be present to the beautiful world around me, and let peace of mind wash over me.
This is one more reason why I love yoga. So often, the lessons that I learn in my yoga practice, are more than just yoga lessons, they are life lessons.
The first episode of Yoga Bliss aired today on The Indonesia Channel! If you aren't in an area where it airs, stay tuned, streaming should be available soon. 😃

Scorpion pose is an interesting experience for me. Often, practicing this pose is more a practice of checking my ego than it is a practice of physical asana.

I have a very flexible spine, so it is easy for me to simply "dump" into this pose and set my feet right on top of my head. When I do this it looks pretty cool, but it also forces my core to disengage. Once my core has disengaged I lose control and I flip over every time.
Sure, I could snap a photo at the last moment before I fall and show you all how wonderful I look in a "perfect" scorpion pose. However, that's not what

Spent the first day of the year off the grid with my dad and @robinnectar, hiking to Hanakapi’ai Falls. 👣
We all slept right through 12am on New Years Eve, in order to wake up at sunrise feeling fresh. This was one of the first January 1st’s in a while, where I didn’t wake up with any kind of hangover (so much better!)! 💆🏼‍♀️
Instead, I woke up feeling ready to slay 2018, and then I confirmed it with a “not messing around” 8 mile hike. 💪🏻
Some say that the way you spend the first day of the year will act as a metaphor for the rest of the year to follow. 🤷🏼‍♀️
Seems a little superstitious to me, but if I follow this logic, then my next year will be one of early days, hard work, moments where I question everything, progress, feeling lost, achievement, feeling found, stepping out of my comfort zone, re-learning old lessons, challenges followed by immense payoffs (like this view!), and lots of time spent eating yummy food with people I love. 🙌🏻
If there is any truth in superstition, then it seems like I’m in for an epic year! 💗
.

Throwing it all the way back to my first yoga photo that I ever posted on Instagram. I can't believe that it's only been 1 year! This photo is from my Grand Canyon trip with @erincasey28 last May, one week after I joined Instagram.

My, how time flys when you're having fun, right? Thank you to @erincasey28 for knowing I would love Instagram, and suggesting it to me last year. Thank you also for taking this photo, one of my favorites EVER.

Something about this photo really resonated with me. Looking at it made me feel calm, inspired and happy. I wanted to share these "insta-emotions" with others.
Maybe this photo would have the same impact on other people, as it had on me, and bring a little more joy into a few people's lives. I hoped so, but I was also afraid to share my life with people who might judge me.

It was this hope that gave me the confidence to get over my concern for perception of perfection and put myself out there. It's not always easy to be vulnerable to so many people, but for me it has been rewarding in so many other meaningful ways.

One of the most rewarding aspects are all of your awesome comments filled with love and encouragement. If I'm ever feeling down, I don't have to look any further than your encouraging comments for an amazing pick-me-up.
I just wanted to take this moment to say THANK YOU.

When I was growing up, my parents had a rule that I had to read a book for an hour everyday. 🤓
.
There were times when I resented this rule, but more often than not, I ended up really enjoying that hour of getting lost in the stories and characters. 📖
.
As an adult, I’m really grateful for this experience growing up. I still love reading, and actually still get that hour in most days. ⏱
.
I usually read fiction, and I especially love a good spy novel, but my favorite books ever are probably “Jitterbug Perfume” and “Still Life With Woodpecker”, both you Tom Robbins, and “The Great Gatsby” by F. Scott Fitzgeral. Getting lost in the characters and stories still thrills me! 😃
.
Do you have an activity, that you loved as a kid, and still continue to love as an adult? Do you have a book that you know I would love? 💗
.
If the answer to either of these questions is “YES!”, please comment below and share! 🙌🏻🙌🏻
.

Before I went to bed last night, after a wonderful day, it occurred to me that I often ruminate on what went wrong in a day, but don't always give the same energy to reliving and appreciating what went right in a day.
.
So, I did something I rarely do of my own accord: I meditated. 😳
.
Meditating, in the sense of clearing my mind, scares me. It's really difficult for me to entirely empty my mind of thoughts, and with this as my goal, I often ending up feeling like a meditation fail.
.
Last night though, I gave myself a theme and a challenge (challenges motivate me). I set a timer for 5 minutes, closed my eyes, and silently started listing people and things, as fast as I could, both big and small, that I'm grateful for. 🙏🏻
.
My challenge to myself was to find so much gratitude that I would run out of time before I ran out things to list. This seemed a tall order, because 5 minutes of mediation, to me, usually feels like 20 (and not in a good way. 😉).
.
However, with the theme of gratitude as my guide, 5 minutes ended up feeling more like 2, and before I knew it my timer had chimed and my meditation fears felt even more ridiculous than usual.
.
I woke up with a smile, and maybe even a new nighttime ritual. ✌🏻💗😃
My big plan for today includes: a bikini, a bathrobe, and basically walking around like I own the place. 🤷🏼‍♀️😉

I’m working on learning to trust the universe. 🔮
.
Which is a funny thing for me to write, because I’ve always been staunchly of the school of thought that says it’s perseverance and effort that really make the world go round, not trust in the universe. 💪🏻
.
However, I’m learning more and more that it’s actually equal parts of both. 🤷🏼‍♀️
.
If I’ve learned anything, it’s that even the best laid plans can’t account for unexpected bouts of stormy weather— and I’ve def. had some of that lately. 🌪
.
I’m still putting in all of my effort and perseverance, but I’m also practicing trusting the universe to make the sun come out— or at least trusting that my recent storms will sprout some unexpected wildflowers. 🌸
.
A little update, things are looking up! I made my psycho landlord issues a thing of the past, and moved into a new home (with the sweetest landlord ever 😇). 🏡😍🙌🏻
.
Thanks for hanging in there during my absence of the past almost 2 weeks. It makes me feel so grateful to know I have the space to take a break now and then and still be welcomed back to this loving community when I’m ready. 🙏🏻
Take your peace with you wherever you go, and you will always be able to access the quiet within you, even in the loudest of places. ✌
So excited about my new shoes that I broke out a little firefly flow and a smile. 😃
When I practice creating balance in my yoga practice, I improve my ability to create balance in my life. ✌

If you had any question about the validity of my Peruvian nature backgrounds, I believe that this might silence your reticence to believe. Loving the scenery of mountains and glacial lakes more than I ever could have imagined. ❤️

I challenge myself to make each day and each trip more epic than the last. I don't always succeed, but here in Costa Rica I'm winning. ☀️

I've already made solid headway on my spring cleaning around the house, but now I need to spring clean my soul. I'm ready to make some changes. 🙌🏻
.
We can all choose how we want to spend our time, and I've taken stock and found 4 habits that I am making a point to spend less time on from here on out:
.
1. I will avoid watching TV during the day.
2. I will avoid negative conversations about other people, unless they are in a problem solving context.
3. I will be less reactive to uncomfortable feelings of fear, anger, and sadness.
4. I will avoid making assumptions about others feelings, opinions, and intentions.
.
In the mission of improving oneself and breaking bad habits, I find it better to add than simply subtract. In place of my old habits I will be doing these things instead:
.
1. Spend more time outside.
2. Spend more time discussing what I love and admire about people I know.
3. Take more deep breaths and force myself to experience a waiting period before I react.
4. Communicate when I don't understand someone's behavior, and ask them to clarify.
.
These changes won't necessarily be easy, and won't happen overnight, but I'm determined to be a happier, calmer, less stressed, and more discipline me.
.
If you were to spring clean your soul, what are some changes that you would make? 💗
.
.
.
📸: @the.walshman

After I quit competing in rhythmic gymnastics as a teenager, it took me several years to find the right form of fitness for me.
I missed the way that rhythmics had tested my strength, flexibility, and balance all at the same time.
I played a few different sports in high school, and during college, I would get motivated to go for a run now and then, but running never really lit my fire.
Then I was invited to a yoga class, and everything changed. I was immediately hooked. It was exactly what I had been searching for! Like rhythmics, my yoga practice challenges me to utilize my strength, flexibility, and balance (both in my body and my mind) all at the same time, and THAT lights my fire.

Once I've read all of your stories, I'll be randomly selecting one lucky storyteller to be gifted a $100 @aloyoga gift card.

To share your yoga start story and be eligible for the gift just follow these steps:

1. Upload a photo on @instagram and share your personal story of how you started doing yoga.

Filming "Yoga Bliss" for The Indonesia Channel took my handstands to a whole new level.
There is a core section in the majority of the episodes, so my core got a lot stronger during the course of filming.

If you're wanting to take your handstands to the next level, start with your core and build up from there. Your core will be the foundation of your stability, so make it strong!

Once your core is stronger and your handstands are steadier, then you can take your core work upside down, by moving your legs around in handstand. Super fun core workout!

While riding the gondola to the top of the mountain at sunrise, my breath started fogging the cold window pane. I drew this heart with my finger and felt like a kid again.
I live in Arizona now, but I grew up in Michigan, where it was often cold and there were lots of chances to draw hearts on foggy windows. I've had kind of a love-hate relationship with Michigan and the life that I led there in the past.
Growing up I was shy, scared, and I often felt like I wasn't good enough. I had very few friends, and those I did have seemed to stab me in the back regularly (as teenage girls unfortunately often choose to do). When I left Michigan to live in Paris for a month at 16 without my parents, everything changed. I was on my own for the first time, free to start writing a life story that I would actually enjoy reading.
I returned from Paris a stronger and more confident young woman, but my life in Michigan still felt stifling and lonely and I couldn't wait to leave again. Instead of just resenting the people who had hurt me during my Michigan youth, I resented the state itself for a long time.

As I drew this heart and reminisced, instead of remembering pain, I remembered only the love I experienced there and the love that I have for the place that I came from.
Growing older can be scary, but one thing that I'm grateful for in this whole aging process is the many chances that I am given to forgive and let go of past hurts as more time passes.

Ask yourself: Who or what can I forgive? What am I holding onto? What points of view are no longer serving me? What stories am I telling myself that are no longer true? The answers to these questions will eventually set you free, if you're willing to face them head on and let them go.

Here is a bit of wisdom from my heart to yours: LET GO. When we let go of past resentment, when we forgive, we are free. In letting go, we make more space to fill with the love and joy of the present moment. ✌️❤️😃

Throwing it back to this memorable moment of bliss.
I often feel like I'm not very "good" at meditating. It's difficult for me to commit and set aside the time to just DO IT...which sounds even more ridiculous than usual, as I read it now.
My struggle? 10 minutes. Just 10 minutes a day, my goal for a long time, is barely any time in the big scheme of my day. How do I manage anything if I can't even manage to JUST SIT for 10 minutes?
Even if I struggle daily with meditation, when I was sitting by this waterfall in Cambodia a few years ago, it just happened. Naturally. Beautifully. Blissfully.

The moment, captured in this photo, showed me that I AM "good" at meditation...if I just let it happen. As I sat, I let meditation wash over me and run through me, just like the water; an endless stream of consciousness flowing from one moment to the next. It was a moment of pure being and connection.

I may still struggle daily to meditate, and I am definitely no Osho; but looking at this photo reminds of that experience of pure being and reminds me that all is possible. ✨

I'm smiling on the outside, while kinda flipping out on the inside. It's crazy how, in the same moment, things can be both wonderful and awful, together and falling apart.
I'm both ecstatically happy and incredibly sad about things that have come up lately in my life, and I'm not sure what to make of it all.
Sometimes I feel like my emotions are out of my control, and it's easy for me to go down the rabbit hole and get stuck in the negative emotions, no matter how amazing things actually are.
It makes me feel ungrateful to be in a place this beautiful, and be sitting here in my head, often worrying, rather than being present in the moment.
But then I remind myself that I am responsible for my own feelings, and that I have a choice. I can choose to tune into the positive or the negative.
They will both always be there, and it's important to experience both (no such thing as sunshine all the time unless you're fake or delusional), but I don't necessarily have to experience them in equal measures.
So in this moment, I actively choose light. I actively choose gratitude. That doesn't take away anything that's going on, it doesn't lessen my worries, but it makes everything feel a little better.
When I'm stuck in my head, it's as if I can't see any of the beauty that's right in front me, but once I move, breathe, and calm myself from the inside out, I can see again, and I notice how beautiful our world is, and that makes me feel better too.
Just remember that even if myself and others you follow on Instagram seem happy and lucky all the time, I assure you that things are not always entirely what they seem.
Remember that the next time you envy my life or someone else's. With every bit of good, there's usually also a bit of bad, but we don't always show you that on Instagram.
If you take one thing from this post, please take this: life is a mixed bag, filled with positivity and negativity in equal measures. Don't hide from the negative. It's real and it's there, and it needs to be experienced...but don't let it eat you up, because our world is a beautiful place, and no matter what's going on in my life or yours, there are always so many things to be grateful for. 💗

5x elbow/knee high crunches (R+L)

5x knee/nose crunches (R+L)
5x knee/shoulder raises (outside) (R+L)

10x scissor legs (each side)

10x single leg cross body pulses (R+L)
10x straddle pulses

It’s so hard to catch up on life when I’ve fallen so far behind. After being in bed sick for almost 10 days, there was a lot that didn’t get done.
.
The last couple of days, I’ve woken up in the morning already feeling overwhelmed and tired from just thinking about all the things on my plate.
.
I woke up today wanting to be anywhere else than here, doing anything else than what I’m doing, and feeling different than I feel right now.
.
Even though I’m struggling, I keep going, waiting for it to feel like I’m swimming again, rather than just doing my best to stay afloat.
.
Sometimes that’s all you can do: just keep going, and remind yourself that however you feel today, won’t be how you’ll feel forever. That’s easier said than done though, I know.
.
I used to run away and try to escape my life when I’d feel this way, but the truth is, your problems will follow you to even the most idyllic locales. There is no real escape until you face them and do the work.
.
They say the only way out is through, and right now I’m definitely going through it.
.
Whatever you’re going through, just know that you aren’t alone. We’re all going through stuff. I’m here treading water with you, and together we’ll stay afloat. 💗

Usually I love this pose, maybe too much. Besides the fact that it feels awesome to practice; I must admit that I also sometimes love this pose for egotistical reasons.

That being said, today I had an interesting experience. For the life of me, I couldn't stay in this pose or bend as deeply as I usually can. I kept falling out of it and stumbling.
For a moment I felt anxiety...I started asking myself "What is wrong with me?" Then I had to stop, breathe, and stop asking myself that question, because I already know the answer. Nothing is wrong with me, and nothing is wrong with my backbend, it was just my ego talking.

I love my yoga practice for these moments. Even if I sometimes fail to put my ego in check, my yoga practice gets it everytime.
Thank you yoga. Ego, consider yourself in check...at least for the moment...but, I guess that's why we call it a practice.

Another awesome aspect of Burning Man? The ART CARS! What is an art car you ask?
Well, at Burning Man, there are no cars allowed (except to arrive and depart the event of course). During the event, the only cars allowed are those that have been altered to become mobile pieces of art....that you can also drive.

I don't mean hanging some streamers from your windows. Art Cars are serious labors of love for their creators.

In fact, you happen to be viewing my favorite art car right now! This one is called El Pulpo Mechanico. Can you believe that this is actually a "car"? This baby drives around the playa delighting fans and lighting up the night. Enjoy! ✌❤🔥

I hiked 8 miles to get here and it was worth every step, but there were many steps along the way, where that pessimistic voice in my head told me that I couldn’t do it, and I should stop. 😔
.
That voice is my nemesis, as I’m sure it is yours, and I’ve found it uses different tones of voice. Sometimes it whispers “you’re going to fail”. Other times it bellows “You aren’t good enough for this!” 🤔
.
But there’s another voice there too. It’s often quieter, but it’s just as strong. I call it my “Goddess” voice, and it started talking louder when I got my goddess tattoo last year. ✨
.
You have a “Goddess” voice too. It’s there, but maybe you have a different name for it, like intuition, self-awareness, or listening to your gut. 🔮
.
It’s the voice in your head that believes in you. It’s the voice that knows you are far beyond simply being “good enough” for whatever it is you set out to do. It’s the voice that knows exactly how lovable you are, and loves you unconditionally. 💗
.
Each time my inner pessimist told me to stop, my “Goddess” voice calmly responded “NO” and I took another step. This happened again and again, until I found myself standing in awe at the bottom of the falls, feeling validated that my willful mind and my capable body brought me the entire way there, and could do it again! 💪🏻
.
If you’re going to listen to a voice in your head, listen to your “Goddess” voice, not the pessimistic one that puts you down. It will always keep you putting one foot in front of the other, and it will never lead you astray. 🙌🏻
.

I don't know if you've noticed, but I've been struggling to post lately.
.
Not sure when, but at some point I became convinced that every post I make has to be the best post I've ever made. That's a lot of pressure to put on myself and it's taken a toll lately. If the photo isn't color and light-corrected, hair perfect, pose perfect, most interesting backdrop ever, etc. I've been struggling to post it. Lame.
.
As a result, I haven't been feeling very inspired to post lately. It's hard to live a perfectly "on brand" life and be so concerned with appearances all the time. It takes a ton of energy, and I feel like I've allowed this self-inflicted pressure to make me overly self-conscious, fearful, and exhausted.
.
You can see the fear manifesting in my captions too, I'm sure. I used to write about my life pretty openly, good and bad, and I still sometimes do, but now my captions are often just that: captions to describe what you can already clearly see is happening in the photo. Not very inspiring.
.
This is happening, because I've often been afraid to write about how I'm actually feeling (things have been hard for a few months now since my breakup and move to LA). I fear that if I show you other, maybe darker, sides of me, other than the bright shiny ones you already love and enjoy, then you'll think I'm a buzzkill and unfollow me. So I write, sometimes inauthentically, about flowers and unicorns instead, because I tell myself that's what you want from me.
.
Long story short: I'm sorry I tried so hard to be perfect, and in the process may have inadvertently sometimes become boring, inauthentic, and even unrelatable. I've honestly been a bit bored and uninspired by my posts lately, so I don't blame you if you've felt the same way sometimes.
.
I'm going to make a point to get back to my real self, not my "perfect" self. Sometimes I'm happy, and I feel inspired, and inspiring. Other times I'm sad, unmotivated, and I have a hard time...but inspiration can be found there too, in realness, strength, and vulnerability; and I need to remember that more often.
.
Mantra: Life is still beautiful and can still be inspiring, even if there are no flowers or unicorns present. ☀️

When @justinbastien was taking this photo, I couldn't figure out what he was shooting. I wanted to practice a yoga pose and make the shape of my body more complex, more interesting.

Just standing there didn't feel like enough, but @justinbastien kept telling my to stay put, so I did. And it turns out that I love this simple and authentic photo.

It's funny how so often we tell ourselves that it's not enough to just be who we are. That we must show off or make ourselves seem more complex and interesting to be accepted and loved.

Simplicity and authenticity are some of the most beautiful qualities in the world. Trust that you are enough, just as your are. Stand strong and grounded in your identity and love your reflection. ✌️ Photo: @justinbastien 📷

Announcing my first @codyapp plan, Introduction to Yoga with @mackenzieyoga!
If the idea of joining a Yoga class makes you feel a bit intimidated, this month-long series is the perfect way to introduce yourself to the poses and flows found in most entry-level Vinyasa or Ashtanga classes!

codyapp.com/introtoyoga (link in bio)

This plan consists of 12 workouts that repeat over a 30-day period. During our time together you will gain a basic understanding of fundamental standing postures such as Sun Salutations, Downward Dog and Warrior.

We will also open up your body with backbending stretches, help you feel comfortable upside down with some inversion variations, and work your core with strengthening exercises.
This program is the best way to begin establishing your own Yoga practice and learn how it can make you feel great in your body! I’m so excited to share the gift of Yoga with you! ❤️

Even though I just landed in Phoenix, I'll share with you one more video from this morning in the Detroit airport.

Some of you commented on my last post and said you had always wanted to get your airport yoga on, but were afraid to be seen and/or judged by others.

The truth is, I have always had the same fear. Today was my first ever airport yoga session, and I'll admit, I was scared at first too.

The beauty of yoga is, that as soon as I took my first breath of my practice, my fear vanished. I forgot about the fear of judgement from others and I let the yoga flow through me. I found my peace and kept it with me through the entire flight.

I highly recommend that you set your fears aside and rock out some airport yoga before your next flight.
Your body and your mind will thank you before, during, and after your flight. ✌️❤️😃

Today was my second time ever trying SUP yoga and it was SO fun! The first time was over a year ago, and it seemed so much harder then.

At that point, every time I tried to practice a forearm stand on the board, I face planted. I was hesitant to give this one a try this time around, thinking I would have the same results, but I went for it anyway and totally surprised myself. Turns out I've gotten a lot stronger and gained control in the last year.

Love those exciting "AHA!" moments when I step out of my comfort zone and find out that something I believed to be impossible is in fact possible. Proving myself wrong when I tell myself "I can't" always gets me thinking... What else am I telling myself that I can't do? Am I telling myself the truth or reacting to fear and past memories? ✌️@fsborabora

A note to all the ladies out there, especially the teenage girls: chill out on the cattiness and try practicing love instead.
If you already are practicing love on the daily, thank you for setting a beautiful example of how to be an empowered and loving woman. We aren't all catty, thank goodness, but unfortunately A LOT of us are.
I got an above average number of nasty comments on my last video, a simple video of me practicing yoga on a beach. The sad thing is that the vast majority of the mean comments were from other women, mainly teenage girls. In my experience, this is almost always the case when it comes to rude comments.

Girl on girl nastiness makes me so sad. It's so unnecessary. What does it achieve? Does it really improve your life to call me a slut or tell me I look anorexic? I'll go ahead and answer for you: no, it doesn't.
Why then are we as a gender so frequently judgmental and mean to our fellow women? Nasty comments from woman to woman don't just hurt the one on the receiving end, they hurt us all by perpetuating a negative cycle that often starts in our teenage years.

Instead of trying to empower yourself by putting others down, I invite you to empower yourself by empowering others. Give compliments instead of slighting each other. Encourage instead of discouraging.
I accept that negative comments are an unfortunate part of my reality, because I put myself out there and share my life with the world. But how lame is it that I have to accept this as reality?
What would the world look like if we were quicker to be nice to each other than to be mean? Let me answer for you again: it looks AWESOME. That's a world that I want to live in. Join me. ❤️

Thank you so much for all of the love, good vibes, and birthday wishes yesterday!

I had such a fun day and spent time with some of my favorite people in the whole world.

At dinner, we went around the table and told stories of fun experiences that we had had together. The biggest theme in all of the stories that included me, was saying YES.
I say yes a lot, maybe even too often, but saying yes has led me down a lot of amazing paths in life. Saying yes can change your life, it has changed mine so many times.

Listening to my friends stories, my yes practice is apparently contagious. Each one had a story of how yes had changed their lives.
Don't let fear drag you down or make you miss out on life. Yes can be scary, but it can also be immensely rewarding.

Yes brought me to every one at the dinner table and I'm grateful to my awesome friends for reminding me that putting fear aside and saying yes changes lives.

Say yes to love. Say yes to laughter. Say yes to new experiences. Say yes to life. ❤️

Today I hired a professional organizer to help me clean my room. It was necessary, to an embarrassing degree. This is the result.
Realizations from the morning: I love printed clothing. I'm awful at unpacking suitcases. I'm really great at washing and folding laundry, not so great at putting it away once it's folded. I apparently enjoy collecting empty bottles on my nightstand. Dirty laundry can hide in the weirdest places (how did it get there? I'd never put it there). The biggest realization though, is that I'm an expert at putting tasks off, when I'm not excited to complete them.
People have always told me, "clean room, clean life." "organized room, organized mind." I didn't like to hear this, because, as a procrastination expert in the field of bedroom cleaning, I always told myself I didn't need an organized room to have an organized mind. I lied.

Having a clean bedroom makes a huge difference in the way I feel. I always forget this, but today it is an obvious difference between the way I felt when I woke up this morning (dirty room) and the awesome way I feel now (clean room). The aimless anxiety that I've been carrying for weeks, but couldn't place, GONE. The guilt of knowing I should be doing something, but instead I am choosing to procrastinate, GONE. Smile, sanity, RESTORED.

My new favorite moving meditation: Cleaning my room. What are you putting off in your life?

Things I'm learning on Kauai... 👣
Developing my meditation practice has always been a struggle. I'm often literally afraid to just sit and be.
It's difficult to quiet my mind, be patient, and sit with what is, rather than trying to muscle my way through it and force someone or something to change.
Since I've been here, I've fallen into the trap of island time, which is usually a major practice in controlling my impatience (and temper lol), and meditation has come more naturally to me.
I find myself asking difficult questions, falling into unplanned meditative states (which, it turns out, are nothing to be afraid of), and then coming out with answers that I've been looking for forever.
Things feel right. Right here. Right now. ✌🏻️

Okay yogis. Let's get real for a second.
This afternoon I put up a video of me waking up. Yes, I made my hair into a pretty looking shape on my pillow. Admittedly, there was some ego involved. So sue me! We all have a little ego inside us, it's part of being human.

I woke up today and I liked the way I looked. Caught. Usually I dislike the way I look in the morning. All morning breath and messy hair. Today, for once, I felt differently.

I felt pretty and that made me happy. Is that such a crime? Apparently some of you think it is. I'm not sure why.

To those of you who left me nasty comments (some of which I actually deleted because they were so hateful) I'm sorry that you're having a rough day. However, that doesn't give you license to shit all over me, just because I am in fact having a GREAT day.

Please look inside yourselves and ask why you choose to spend your time and energy attempting to kill others joy. Does it make you feel any better?
Can't we all just get along? Even though it's not easy in this moment, I am choosing to practice love and forgiveness. To those of you who left me nasty comments, I love you and I forgive you.

PS. You can call me Tim, because your hateful words don't hurt me, they help me practice being a stronger person. ✌
Be light, be bright, be happy, and have an AWESOME day today! ❤️

Sometimes it's hard to take it easy. It feels natural for me to push myself as far as I can go. I'm comfortable with that.

This last week has been a challenge for me, because I've been forced out of my comfort zone and into taking it easy.
I strained my back a week ago, by twisting a little too deeply. Don't worry, it's not bad and I'll be fine, but I've been taking it really easy on myself to make sure I don't hurt myself any further.

It's been a real eye-opener about my practice and how attached I have become to handstands and advanced poses.
Now that I've been taking a break from the advanced poses I've been afraid to post. Afraid that if I'm not doing a handstand or tangling myself into a pretzel, that you guys won't like me or will unfollow me.

So, truly getting out of my comfort zone, this isn't a handstand or a pretzel, just a basic upward dog...and man, after hardly practicing for a week, the basic sun salutation, that this photo came from, felt as wonderful as any handstand I've ever done.

What have I learned? Several important lessons: -always practice safety first and respect my body and my limitations -don't be SO attached to advanced poses, because the basics feel just as good -don't be so attached to the opinions and "likes" of others -taking it easy isn't the same as taking a step back, if anything it's a step forward in my personal growth

Today is the first day that I'm feeling pretty close to back to normal. So, I'm sure you'll be seeing handstands and pretzels from me again in no time.

Even if it's been challenging this last week, I'm still grateful for the experience and the important lessons that I've learned.

Never be afraid to love yourself and take it easy sometimes. You deserve it. 💗

When I was a kid, my dad said to me "Caitlin, you have beautiful eyes. If you learn how to use them, you'll get anything you want." I didn't believe him. I told him I thought I looked like a bug (it took me a while to grow into my features). Nowadays my eyes are my favorite feature. My compliment to myself: "Caitlin, you have beautiful eyes, and your smile helps other people smile too." 😃 I'm a very confident person, yet I struggled with the urge to put on makeup and edit this photo after I snapped it. Instead it's just me (minus my eyelash extensions lol). In our photoshopped world, it can be harder than ever before to love ourselves just as we are, that's why I'm so proud of all of you for so courageously putting your selfies out there.
I want to thank all of you for your deep and vulnerable selfie shares. I woke up and read them for awhile this morning and I started crying. Happy tears. You are all so brilliantly beautiful. Please don't ever tell yourselves anything different. ❤️ Now for Day 5: Practice Yoga From The Inside Out
Tomorrow we will focus on how your yoga practice impacts your life, outside of yoga clothes, off the mat, from the moment you wake up until the moment you fall asleep.

Yoga isn't just about the physical poses. It's about how we relate to the world in general from day to day. Yoga is a lifestyle and a way of being.

We practice the physical poses to help us prepare for challenges that we will face from the moment we step off of the mat.

Here I am falling out of a handstand. Yes, even I fall sometimes.
I have another pre-fall photo from right before this moment, where you could say my handstand looked "perfect." I thought of posting that one, but I like this one better, because it got me thinking.
Was the moment where I was holding the handstand any more or less "perfect" than this moment? Did falling make me imperfect? Or had I been imperfect all along before I even walked outside?

I meditated on these questions, and here's what I came up with:

I am not perfect. I am not imperfect. I am perfectly imperfect. I was perfectly imperfect when I woke up this morning. I was perfectly imperfect while I was holding the handstand and while I was falling. I am perfectly imperfect as I write this.

Life is perfectly imperfect and that's what makes it so amazing. With this beautiful duality, there is always more to learn and room to grow.

When I love and fully embrace my imperfections, I experience the sensation of perfection that is already there, hiding right next to my imperfections, waiting for me to notice it. Perfectly imperfect.

Do you love your perfectly imperfect self? I do. I love you because you are perfectly imperfect. I love you because I am perfectly imperfect. I love you because we are perfectly imperfect.

Let's be our perfectly imperfect selves and love it. Longtime. ❤️

When I first started seriously posting to Instagram, my dad (who proclaims himself to be "analog not digital") asked me why I was doing this. He didn't get it, didn't see my vision.

I remember telling him "because one day, I'm going to have 10,000 followers and @marahoffman (one my favorite designers) will invite me to her studio." He thought I was crazy, until I did have 10,000 followers and @marahoffman did invite me to visit her studio...a huge turning point for me. My vision became my reality.

That was more than a year ago now, and so much has changed since then. One thing that hasn't changed is my love for all things @marahoffman and my excitement every time I have a chance to visit her...like today!

Here I am becoming one with @marahoffman's studio and feeling grateful to consider her a friend as well as a huge inspiration in my life.

The moral of the story is: believe in your vision. Believe in yourself. Even if people don't see your vision, keep pursuing it. Even if people think you're weird or crazy, keep going. Know yourself, know your truth, and BELIEVE it.
Remember, you have the power and perseverance to make your vision your reality. ✌️

I used to be afraid of women. So many of them had done me wrong in the past. Growing up, I was backstabbed, shit talked, and everything in between. I had to change schools 4 times, because mean girls chose me as their target, and the whole thing was pretty traumatic. 😥
.
As a result, I used to avoid women like the plague. The majority of my best friends were men, because men felt safer, more predictable, and thankfully, less catty. 🙃
.
But then I grew up, and I started feeling the void of female friends in my life. Slowly but surely, I decided to trust. Slowly but surely, I let my guard down. Slowly but surely, I started collecting girlfriends, until I had as many female friends as male friends. 👯
.
Sure, there are still mean girls out there, even now that we’re all adults, but I’m not afraid of them anymore. I find that fear can be a self-fulfilling prophecy. The more I feared them, the more I attracted them. But then I got to know myself better and love myself more deeply. 💗
.
The more I practiced this self-love and self-acceptance, the less insults, slights, or purposeful exclusion in group situations, were able to impact me. With my new thicker skin, I was less afraid to put myself out there, less afraid of rejection, and less afraid of making new friends. 😃
.
Now, rather than being afraid of women, I cherish all of my girlfriends and I don’t know what I’d do without them. I’m even genuinely excited to make more. 🙌🏻
.
In a world that sometimes praises mean girls, don’t be one of them, and don’t be afraid of them, because that just gives them more power. 🙅🏼
.
Instead, lead by example: support and befriend the women around you. Let’s lift each other up and rise together. Who’s with me?! 🙌🏻💗👯
.
📸: new friend @sfreneenyc

I never realized how liberating it is to get dirty. 😜
I’ve spent too much of my life missing out on opportunities, because they might mess up my hair or ruin my clothes. 🙅🏼‍♀️
I’ve fallen on my ass jumping between river rocks, trying not to get my shoes wet. My feet have slipped right out from under me, every time I try to avoid the mud. 😂
If these experiences have taught me anything, it’s that: like most fears, the fear of getting dirty is far worse than the dirt itself. 💥
And actually, the more I try to avoid getting dirty, the dirtier I get. 😤
If I would have tromped straight through the river or the mud, only my feet would be dirty, but once I fall, it’s everywhere— just as I feared it would be. 😱
Fears are like the mud or the water I tried to avoid. If you face them head on, they’re never as bad as you thought they would or could be, but when you actively avoid them, they have a tendency to cover your entire body. 🤔
Once my feet are wet, my hands and clothes muddy, my hair drenched, and my makeup runny, I am free to romp, roam, swim, float, fall, and do it all with fearless abandon and a twinkle in my eye. 😉
Your fears themselves, are far scarier than whatever it is that you fear, so why not say “fuck it!” and start living. 🙌🏻
.

Happy Thanksgiving! Here are some thoughts on gratitude as I wake up this morning:

Today I'm feeling so grateful. I thought about making a list to share with you, but the truth is that the list is never-ending.
I'm grateful for everything. The good and the bad. The easy and the challenging. The friends and the foes. Gratitude is more than a feeling. It's a practice.

Thanksgiving reminds us to be grateful for a day, but I say, think of everyday like thanksgiving. Practice being grateful for the things that make you happy, but also for the things that make you sad (and stronger). Practice being grateful on the days when it seems like you have nothing to be grateful for. Those are the days, especially, when gratitude leaves the realm of feeling and transcends to the realm of practice.
On the darkest days, the practice of gratitude is a challenge, so be grateful for days like today when gratitude comes easily. Let the feeling fill your heart with love and appreciation. Then remember how that feels.
Put it in a memory jar and save it for the dark days. Gratitude is always there for you. Ready to make you smile, feel loved, and to remind you that life is good, even when it's challenging.

Time to go gorge on Thanksgiving feast now. Nom nom nom.

What does it mean to you to "dance like no one's watching?" I usually try to take this a few steps further and LIVE like no one's watching. It doesn't always work, because technically I often do have at least a few people watching me, and sometimes that makes me second guess myself.

This whole Instagram thing has made me focus more deeply on the practice of living like no one's watching. I'm working on figuring out what that looks like, and learning to listen to my brave heart, even when my fearful mind tells me to be afraid.

It's important to me to feel loved and accepted, but not at the cost of sacrificing the path that I feel I must follow. Not at the cost of sacrificing my belief in myself.

Don't let fear of judgment or failure slow you down. Follow your heart and LIVE like no one's watching. ❤️ Photo cred: @briancrawfordphotography 📷

It's one of those days. Wednesday. It's cold and rainy here in Phoenix, which I love on days when I can just stay in bed and watch movies and eat soup all day. Today I don't have time for that though, gotta be productive!

Not my most inspiring post ever, so far, but I share this with you because I'm sure you've woken up tired and slightly uninspired too. It happens to all of us.

What do you do on the tired days? How do you motivate? How do you get through it?

I usually get up, take a shower to shake the cobwebs off, and then plan out my day. I take a few small moments to myself to simply gather my thoughts and work on my to-do list for the day. Sometimes seeing what I need to do, on paper, helps me see that it's doable, even if the list is long.

Then, ideally if I have time, I eat a nice breakfast where I don't multitask. No phone. I just enjoy my last few free minutes before I get to work.
Usually by this point, I'm feeling awake, feeling better, and not feeling so overwhelmed. I still have the same amount of stuff to get done, but changing my mood helps me see that I have everything I need, including the energy, to get everything done.

All that being said, I'm feeling better already. Breakfast was yummy and I'm ready to conquer the day. Thanks for listening. ❤️

Today I did something a little crazy. I decided to go surprise an unsuspecting @danielle_cree at work.

Danielle didn't know I was coming, because we had never met. Yesterday, she left a nice comment on my @instagram, inviting me to come check out @snoozeameatery, where she works.

I don't usually go around surprising unsuspecting @gypsetgoddess fans at work, but today I had a wild hair and decided to get out of my comfort zone and do something different.

When I asked if the seat next to her was open, she turned to me, her eyes got wide, she flipped out a little, gave me a huge hug, and then kinda stared at me in disbelief. It was awesome and awkward all the same time, and it made me happy.

I can sometimes be socially awkward, so going out of my way to meet new people can be a challenge. As usual, my social awkwardness was present, but it was far outweighed by another sensation: how great it felt to go out of my way to make a stranger so happy, just because I could.

I've been on a spree with this lately. Random acts of kindness toward strangers that end up being incredibly fulfilling. I'm enjoying myself and making people happy along the way, so I think I'll keep this up.

If you see that I'm in your city, let me know about an event you're going to, or where you'll be working or chilling and when, and I might just come surprise you!

This day turned out to be so much fun. I went from having no plans, to making a new friends' day and taking an amazing tour of Boulder with her...and all of that change happened in the space of a simple decision to do something kind, just for the fun of it, just because I could.

The moral of the story? Share kindness with strangers, whenever you get the chance or the urge, because beautiful things, like new friendships and memories, can come out of this sense of oneness and connection.

BONUS: it just feels awesome to give the gift of happiness to another human. So, go forth and make a stranger smile. 😃

I've noticed an interesting double standard that exists in our society.
Why is it socially acceptable to comment on weight when a person is skinny, but not socially acceptable to comment when someone is overweight? They should both be unacceptable.

I can't count the comments from people telling me I'm too skinny or that I need to "go eat a cheeseburger". Ouch. I delete the majority, but I still see them before I do.

To put this in perspective, if you saw a photo of an overweight person, would it be acceptable to comment "go eat a salad"? Of course not! And it shouldn't be!
Why then, do some of you find it acceptable to leave me comments like that?
Commenting on my body and/or my weight, in a negative way, is mean. Please keep these comments to yourself.
I often wonder if the nasty comment makers would have the courage to make the same remark if they passed me on the street. I highly doubt it.

Everybody play nice. Not just with me, but with everyone in your life. Yes, this includes the people, like me, that you encounter online too. ✌

To those who leave positive comments: I want you to know that I read them ALL. They warm my heart, lift me up, make me feel loved, and inspire me daily. Thank you. ❤❤
